rlqVa6TnRbpwm8cc7NX-Vw.text: The best , very good and service excellent. Better than (Archies). And service very good. Patty spectacular..

xofqVj4ROaqPVowI9sI5Tg.text: I love this place. The service is on point and the food is delicious. For the price you get so much food. I've tried the Pad Thai and a couple of the curries and everything I've had so far has just been perfect. I always recommend this place to my family and friends.

YfHg1w5Sen4S-KUDu9dm7g.text: Had deliver from this place.... Absolutely amazing. Very light twist on your typical Thai food. Not the same boring normal .  Delivery took FOREVER -- reason for the one less star.

RzJaEFqIMkVFjJawietT1Q.text: Staff are all very welcoming, attentive and friendly (I was simultaneously greeted by 3 busy servers as I walked in) - I love how they all seem to work so well together. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and flows well. My to-go order (shrimp pad thai) was awesome and served up promptly. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant!

8JdhdRSUfwpaBVI4Jd51gA.text: I ordered online through Yelp.  The delivery was easy and it was delivered fast!  I highly recommend the mango with sticky rice.

OJjZw1oRvUQSBorfFFwJpQ.text: Genuinely my favorite Thai spot in town! If you don't want to wait in impossible lines for Lotus, you won't be disappointed in Table Thai's food. Tip: ask for a coconut when you sit down, you'll be happy drinking coconut water out of a coconut - then eating the meat from the inside with a spoon! (Ask them to shave the sides for you though, as sometimes they don't. Unless you're up for a challenge with your meal.) the menu features veg and vegan options, (ask if other things can be made vegan, my favorite is Tom Kha  Kai as spicy as possible with tofu made vegan.) there are special plates/boxes, and as always, if you've never had one - you MUST get a Thai Ice Tea (only if you have a sweet tooth though.) You won't be disappointed. :)

lMVcdqnfZW1kjR6kJI4q8Q.text: Had the yellow curry, and it was great. It was flavorful and filling and chef was not stingy at all with the meat. The staff helped as best they could and were nice; gave me an extra bowl of rice without charging me. Not too expensive and worth the price.

bDgAqnGKs7VELfbpotDP0g.text: We went there tonight because Ping Pong across the street was closed, and I have to say thank god it was.  We ordered the Asia Sample, Yellow Curry, and Drunken Noodle.  The food was so delicious that I had to write a review (and I never review anything).  The food was delicious, the service was courteous, and the atmosphere was great (nice booths, wall hangings, and so on).  I absolutely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for delicious Thai food!

kWw-z_Ou3BEUGUCASPAseA.text: Ana was a wonderful delightful  hostess , food was incredible out of this world.   Yes we would come back again if in Vegas

JtIoilOa6NnMVdTXPv-USA.text: Been going here since day one and due to the consistently HIGH quality service and food I have no hesitation giving 5*. We're Vegan and they cater to our every whim, and then some - having products we've not had elsewhere before.

ZiS6dwr34wD7ZI9yULULJQ.text: The best thai restaurant I've tried on this side of town. I love that they have vegan options. Everything seems so much fresher then other places I've ordered from. They also delivery quite far, which I love!

MLhVPF4OsNXWW1TvgLMWOw.text: By far the best Thai!!!!!!! Ordered the green bean with chicken. Beware it has LOTS of garlic, but I loved it as I am infatuated with garlic. Also they have mango sticky rice year long!!!

-ODJu0T8F-7F35Mm_b2eaA.text: First meal in Las Vegas and it was fabulous. Rolled into Vegas the night before and we went driving around and found this gem of a restaurant. Food was wonderful.

M3MHJj49c5XJ10KbUX07kg.text: This place is a hidden gem. The service is excellent and food tastes amazing. They have a great lunch menu that includes dumpling soup and a salad. The dumpling is amazing. I highly recommend this place for lunch. Most items on lunch menu are between $7-$9.

lfH4EuJgc8vaeDor-5Kv6Q.text: Don't know why I didn't trust the review on the pad thai, but it's gross.  It really does seem like they put red dye in it and it has a weird consistency.

oeRGvn5OiA6uP3-WHdOp5w.text: Wow. This was a drive from our house, but we saw many great reviews and boy was it worth it. First, although the inside isn't huge, it is very comfortable and inviting. We started out with the Shu Mai appetizer, followed by the Tom Kha soup for my wife and the beef Prik King for me. The food was all supurb and even though Table Thai is about a 30 minute drive, it is now our favorite Thai restaurant and we will definitely be going back often.

Aknv87pLOjCMVAiMowc2cA.text: The food is good and you can tell it's made with love. Although, it was definitely not the best Thai food I've tasted, it goes without saying I wasn't floored.  It was just good...  Staff was very friendly, inviting and attentive. The restaurant ambiance is very nice and a place you could take a date to.  Only negative was I ordered a 4 spicy, on a 1-5 scale and it wasn't spicy at all. I had to ask for the spice tray to adjust to my liking. If you like spicy you may want to ask for the spice tray up front since they don't automatically have them at the table.  Overall, good restaurant, good food, great ambiance and friendly staff. I will be back!

O_gMaSwitdSvekxh5EbnQg.text: Ordered a lot of food and didn't have long to wait. Everything arrived hot and was yummy. Grub hub delivery guy very nice and I was very happy with my experience.

2B2QwLKuFwjsKPjL45knjQ.text: My friend has strict dietary restrictions, and I just happen to love reading yelp reviews. We came here in October to check it out and fell in love. It has been my favorite restaurant for months.  We have had the Massuman Curry, Tom Kha Soup, Thai Tea Crepe Cake, Mango Sticky Rice, Spicy Eggplant, Salmon with Mango Salsa, and their amazing Thai ice tea with coconut milk. They always make sure everything is safe for my friend, and it's always delicious.  It's easy to tell that their food is homemade. Whether I eat here or order delivery, the quality is consistent. A nice, rich, and creamy Tom Kha with the right amount of lemongrass can be hard to come by, but Table Thai does it right. If you have a sweet tooth, the Thai Tea Crepe Cake is a must have. The food is amazing, and they always remember a friendly face. This is definitely a place worth visiting and returning to.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ambience

tX6nqvVw4icFU-6qI0r81A.text: Had some Yellow Curry delivered via Door Dash and it totally melted in my mouth and satisfied my ever increasing Thai cravings!

bSqT4LrAH0WlbpFRfeqGzQ.text: Being a new restaurant, we came in with no expectations, and left with a new favorite place!  VIBE: cozy with wooden accents, tufted chairs, crown napkin folds. The atmosphere resembles something more native to that of the downtown LV joints -- trendy, but without the crowd (yet). Another indicator of their hipness is the fact they serve their drinks in mason jars. Yes! I had a thai tea and my sister had the thai coffee. Pretty to look at and a generous portion, for only $3. Young coconut for the same price. Sweet deal. Please don't ever change this!  SERVICE: Our waitress was attentive and frequently asked how everything was going. Our dishes timely cleared, waters were constantly filled, though my glass had a small water stain. Side note: Although the name suggests a bar, I didn't really feel like it's much. They do offer wine and beer, though.  FOOD: To start, my family had the Asia Sampler (a combo of shumai, shrimp, satay, spring rolls), but I'd suggest just getting the shumai by themselves, as the other three weren't anything special. We also got the shrimp tom yum soup -- Drained all of our sinuses, spicy, but in a good way.  Our main dishes: duck curry, yellow curry, asparagus with shrimp, teriyaki chicken, pad thai, and pad see ewe, all ranging from $9-$13. Some came with either white or brown rice. My favorite was the pad see ewe. Although they use the good chicken, the yellow curry seemed a little watery and the potatoes weren't tender enough. For dessert, we wanted to try the thai tea crepe cake, but it wasn't available. We settled for the mango with sticky rice and some coconut ice cream instead. Hit the spot. Great presentation. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. thai tea and thai coffee in mason jars! yesss. (favored the coffee over tea)

P3FWrcIsQL_sTflJdv3PBw.text: This was the absolute WORST Thai food I have ever experienced! I catered in PadSeeEw, Pad Thai, Fried Rice, Kung Pao Beef.  The Pad Thai was a dark red sauce onto thick dried up noodles, didn't look like typical pad thai- we threw the entire (tray) contents out, the Pad See Eh Ew was darked overcooked noodles and the Kung Pao Beef taste horrible. The only food descent to eat was the Fried Rice. I paid $189 for the most disgusting food - and highly recommend YOU NOT order from this place.

oK6N2aWistUzhT0TXBn3pA.text: Nothing amazing or WOW about this restaurant...  The food was lacking substance, flavor, and quality.  The prices were surprisingly high given that this is an off-strip, small restaurant.   Will not be returning.

Zlwl4JljrFIFa898oHteyQ.text: This place is one of my most favorite Thai Restaurants.  When I think of Weera, Kin Thai, Siri Thai, Sakun Thai, Naga, Gaati, Komol, Lotus of Siam, Lucki and all the other places in town, I love coming back to Table Thai Bar and Bistro.  1. Service - The staff here are very nice and friendly. You always feel welcome here.  they are very attentive and making sure you are taken care of. Even when it is busy, they are available.  2. The Food - The food here is great.  Lunch - For about 7-10 dollars, you can order 1 of about 10 specials from curry to spicy basil or pad thai.  Your will have a nice lunch size serving of the dish, as well as soup, rice and a small salad. I find that this is a great deal and the amount of food is just right.  Great food, great flavor and great price. Can't beat that.  Entrees - They have just about any and all Thai dish that you could want.  I won't go into any great details as the choices are similar everywhere.  Here are some highlights though:  Ground Meat - I love to have ground pork on my Thai dishes and some places have it, and some don't. HEre they have the ground pork. It captures the sauce and spicy flavors so much better than larger cuts of meat.  The best part, is that they can do ground chicken as well.  I generally prefer the consistency of the ground meats in Thai cooking. Not many places can do ground pork or ground chicken!  Tom Yum - I always enjoy it when the soup comes out in the soup hot pot with the fire in it steaming. Here it is just right and slurpiliciously good.  Vegan Menu - Many places will have a vegetarian menu, but here they have a separate Vegan menu. That is great, especially since the daughter has been a vegan now for about 5 months.  3.  Ambiance - The amount of tables, the design and everything about this very small restaurant is just right. I love coming here with the family and also on business lunch meetings.  GK says, check it out. One of my favorite Thai restaurants.

jjz65mu0J7kQ6H4JmEbjvw.text: Heads up kitchen closes at 10:30 even though Yelp lists open till 11pm. Just drove 15 minutes after work to arrive at 10:35pm to be told kitchen closes at 10:30pm even though there was another person just starting their main course. Very disappointing was really looking forward to it. Unlikely I'll ever give it another chance.

kt0HJEFvW6QUC4y65qvjFA.text: Every so often, Yelp fails me. This is that time. What's up with the almost perfect average rating?!?!?! =/  Came here for dinner on a weekday evening. It was prime time dinner hour (around 7-7:30p) and there was only one other table besides us.   First star removal: no wine and liquor? Why not?  But yet there's the word "bar" in your name. By all means, I'm no alcoholic. I actually can't stand the taste of alcohol. My boyfriend simply wanted a glass of wine to go with his dinner. They're been open for what?.....about 6 months now? Or more? Why are they still waiting for their liquor license?   Second star removal: the food. Just wasn't very tasty. Bland chicken + shrimp pad thai. Not flavorful at all. And only 2 shrimps!?! For a dinner sized entree!? I ordered the chicken thai basil fried rice. Definitely didn't look like FRIED RICE. It was more like mushy rice. The rice was all stuck together and it was kinda.....soggy....if that makes sense. Maybe the rice was under-cooked? Chicken was dried too. Tasted even worse as leftovers and I am NOT a snob when it comes to eating my food two days in a row. I actually love leftovers, but not with this. Minus another star for that.  Only good thing was the appetizer sampler. Two vegetable eggrolls, three chicken satays and 3 shui mais. At least they made that good. We came, we saw, we're done.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken basil spicy fried rice.

mODHbBIHKmYeXTTKbz6DKQ.text: My favorite Thai place to go in town! Small dining area but love the ambiance. Prices are reasonable and you get good portions. I like that they serve brown rice as an option as well. Everything I have had on the menu is delicious but my absolute favorite is the spicy eggplant and though I am not a vegetarian or vegan, I get it with tofu. fKclQVGfQSNGCTZZi1UKWg.text: My husband and I love coming here for date night! The food is unbelievable and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic night. This is definitely a hidden gem.

PFL8_aBYKQFrApvaytyZNQ.text: 267. Met up with a friend who was also in town. This place is really close to the airport, so it's convenient for those who are either just arriving or about to leave.  I ordered the pineapple fried rice. There wasn't anything amazing to write home about. A tad pricey given a fairly average entree. I will say that when I was there, the service was on point. Maybe because there weren't a lot of people on a Friday afternoon, but at least we weren't being ignored. +1 for making an effort to check in with us multiple times.

FG8uGjr_le65NwK6EdDFgw.text: Excellent service, terrible food. The vegetarian spring rolls were really good. The pad se ew was tasty but the broccoli was cold even after they took it back to reheat the same plate.  (it would have been appropriate to prepare a fresh, hot dish for proper flavor and consistency of the noodles).  The pumpkin shrimp was also warm rather than hot.  Disappointing.  I would recommend going to another place for authentic Thai.

_5DqRbzqq6e88StWf8VoFg.text: Our absolute favorite Thai place to go. Even better than Lotus of Siam! Patti is always very friendly and helpful with good recommendations. Their vegetarian menu is fabulous!

wNeErBi-4iDUTlsojFihLg.text: Everything was perfect to us! Service was 5 star from the second we walked in to the second we left. The food was amazing. Everything tasted healthy and had a lot of flavor. This will definitely be our new goto spot.

VnrNDbJdiKjKvFeHluJedQ.text: This is some of the best Thai I've ever had! Loved the dancing shrimp salad it was an explosion of flavors! The duck rolls were fresh and tasty, the Mongolian tofu amazing, and Thai tea crepe fantastic! Can't wait to return and try it all! Great service and atmosphere.

503CU_4gUZBmbk6OCKn6VQ.text: Quickly becoming one of my favorite lunch time spots. My company moved into the area and I've been in 3 times. Anna and her team have been friendly each time there. I've had the Drunken Noodles (twice) and Pad Thai another time. Delicious.

gwatOpXrq7IuIJsYcwwQ7A.text: Fast, delicious, and very affordable! Must try! Great Lunch specials! The Tofu Pad Thai is very yummy!

ksRtpmsMR7bqBVrKKzmCTw.text: Wow! So, so good... service excellent. In fact,  needed a little more rice for our dish, and no extra charge like most other places!  They know how to treat and appreciate their customers!! Oh,  and FRESH brewed ice tea... the best!

wbizrBowgiUpyvI5gkS5cA.text: I stopped in here not knowing if they offered take out service. Luckily for me, they do! Anna walked up and offered to get me a menu and then took the time to explain the vegan options for me. She was very nice, and helpful. I loved the way the vegan menu was on the first page and everything was nicely explained.   I ended up choosing the Tropical Tofu and I was not disappointed, the flavors were wonderful. The portion size was huge, in fact I am finishing up my leftovers tonight. Very good pricing for the amount and quality of the food you get. I really appreciated the fact that if I had wanted something not on the Vegan menu they would have made changes to make it vegan.   The restaurant itself has a very good energy, nicely decorated and warm. I will be back to dine in when I have more time to enjoy and relax. Oh, and they offer online ordering and delivery service.

oa49bYicdnMusNFtVFDaZQ.text: Amazing place! Been here for lunch and dinner and never disappointed. The wonton soup is the best I've ever had (although I wish they'd cut the tails off the added shrimp). So many favorites, never a disappointment.

q1UzeW82_hqcSpgH_m_0GQ.text: I am giving 5 stars not just because the food was great (could maybe have had a spicier peanut sauce on the satay), but also because they were just a fantastic group of ladies running the place.  Very nice, modern interior, great "American" Thai food choices. I had Chicken Satay (generous, 5 skewers), Basil Chicken, standard Thai Iced Tea (again generous, big ol' Mason jar) with lastly Sweet Roti and Thai Tea Crepe Cake (apparently a family special).  Then when I asked for a taxi, instead they gave me a ride along since they were headed out to send a delivery.  Extremely nice, helpful, good food.  I would think if I were a local, I would be going here A LOT!

wf7Et4cBHvZ7s28kxupoMA.text: Table Thai is awesome.  My wife and I have been here a few times now and have loved it every time. Service is always quick and the food is some of the best in Henderson. We'll continue to go back.

KXA1A3FzUksCKW_XuXi8Cw.text: First Of All Wow ! This Place Is Amazing I Mean Its A Hole In The Wall With The Location But Inside Is EveryThing But A Hole In The Wall....The Food Was Great ! Its Not Very Spicy For Being At The Max Spicy Level But The Pagnang Curry Was A 10/10 And The Staff Was Very Nice Even Replaced My Food When I Droped It Over The Table Which I Tryed To Say No Its Okay But They Went Above And Beyond And Didnt Let Me Say No They Did Forget My Thai Tea I Ordered But That Just Shows There Still Humans And Not Thai Gods(Goddesses Cause I Though They Were) And In Return They Gave Us 2 Thai Teas For The Road On The House Even .....So All In All Amazing Experience From The Whole Staff....Not To Mention They Were All Super Cute And Smiley ...Specially Patty ....Deffinitly Going Back...Hope To See My Waitress/Thai Goddess Again

bCeeIP6UvLiNxejALbHKBA.text: Ordered take out from Table Thai this evening because I wasn't sure what the restaurant looked like inside; mall location, dark, etc.. I was pleasantly surprised to see that this location is very nice, clean and refreshing.  The host immediately greeted me and got me my order, then offered me a cold beverage as I waited. I had the Panang Curry-Chicken with the Thai Basil Fired Rice.  Both dishes were incredibly delicious and next time I will be sure to dine inside.

qOxnBEbm6ncqGrHyudzVqg.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner from Table Thai. We were spending the night at a nearby airport hotel because of an early AM flight and did not want to go out for dinner. Everything we ordered was delicious and served to our room in less than the 45 min wait we were quoted. The food was still very warm and each dish was delicious. You can order the degree of spice you wish and we found a 2-3 out of 5 to have a bite but was not overpoweringly hot.   We had the ShunMai which were amongst the best we've ever tasted. The pad see eiw was prepared with delicious thin, wide noodles in a gravy with broccoli ( and we added tofu). It was much lighter than many of the noddles you often get with this dish.  Finally the yellow curry was superbly flavored.  As regular consumers of Asian food in Boston, we were totally impressed. If you are in the LV airport area, we'd highly recommend this place.

eDe2K773Bqvx9ryvE2OtKg.text: Ohmygosh this was delicious!!!!! We came from out of town and stayed nearby. Saturday night, we were looking for a good place to eat and my mom was craving Thai. We did a little yelp hunting and found this place. Literally every single thing we ordered was delicious. In the middle of the meal, my mom commented, "Well we definitely have enough to get a to go box packed up and I can eat it for lunch tomorrow." And by the end of the meal, that was no longer an option. We had cleared our plates. I will absolutely be back whenever we are back in town.

WU4aaqJo2fHIbQHHYk3lww.text: My experience at Table Thai was amazing. Not only was the food delicious, but the staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. For appetizers we had the dumplings (I forgot the actual name) but they were SO yummy. We also had the chicken satay, which were just OK in my opinion. For entrees, my friend and I both had the lunch specials and the chicken curry and pad Thai were both very satisfying and the prices were great. The spice level is also adjusted to your preference which was also great. We ended our meal with the Thai tea crepe cake which is a definite must try! Overall, this is a great restaurant and I will definitely be back to try some more of their great menu items:)

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea crepe cake

3xlm5hWGx8YSEfxaeLn_7Q.text: I just want to give this place a shout out for understanding the Vegan life! When I called to order my pad Thai with tofu, they asked if I was okay with egg. I was happy to see they were cautious of people's potential diet choices. Especially to those people who are new, such as myself and may not know that this dish contained egg.  They also helped me pick an app over the phone that was vegan friendly. When I came in and asked what soup they had available the lady (who didn't take my order) asked if I was vegan and offered Tom kah or something of that nature. Which of course correlated with the diet.  I ordered my pad Thai extra spicy and the soup spicy, they were both phenomenal. I also had an order or crispy veggie rolls, which were delicious with the plum sauce. Thanks for the great food! I'll be back soon!

Everything is fresh and they make sure its brought out the way you want.    Must try the crepe cake!   This isn't an average review, you won't be disappointed.

wezIcMiU-YALYpgR3OPC0w.text: Not bad not good. Servers were polite but appetizers were out in 20 minutes and entrees were out an hour after that. No, maybe only in that zip code.

mOC-95E8a8mmCLXtubADyA.text: This is our favorite place to get Thai food ever. They have a vegan menu and are extremely accommodating for vegans!   Anna and Patty greet us by name, know our favorite dishes and always provide EXCELLENT service. They give us absolutely no reason to dine anywhere else.   Our favorite vegan dishes are: Steamed Vegetable Gyoza, Buddha salad (no egg), Tom Kha Vegetable Soup, Pad Thai (no egg no, fish sauce), Pad See Ew (no egg), and any kind of Curry!

N11iYD4Ke8lcMuxbV4Fr1w.text: MANGO STICKY RICE! Not super sweet and a light sweet for ending your meal. I had the drunken noodle which was good but I didn't find the 4 spicy enough for myself. My husband ordered the Panang curry which I tried and immediately wished I had ordered the same.

dBv_f-EjBF5u5XFzw392jg.text: Amazing food!  Flavors are amazing and they kill the vegan game. Menu is very detailed and have great customer service.    Customer Service 5/5  Food 5/5

qPSsMq35LSJGTjIe-4bITw.text: Had lunch here today. Good lunch specials. Very good curry. There #4 is a gringo 4, I will try there 5 next visit Parking can be had in back. Grub hub is way easyier !  Good Food !

2OMeo0wcdn-QCqln0Dsqrg.text: Best Thai take out we have had in Las Vegas!!  Order us always perfect and food is delicious!  Highly recommend!!

MsGA1NascTUzvl9IYa-dQw.text: My husband and I have always enjoyed this place. We recently discovered that you can request many other dishes be made vegan and we have been delighting in the Panang Curry at least once (okay, twice) a week. Seriously guys, this stuff is holy nectar atop brown rice. In the past we've also really loved their drunken noodles, curry puffs, papaya rolls and Thai teas. I typically call for takeout and my order is always spot on and ready by the time I arrive. Tonight, I ordered delivery through yelp so I'm pretty excited to see how this goes.

rsKGzWaRqOu0OhrJlqApaA.text: I spent a long time contemplating my thoughts on this place,  and after several times getting take out, I feel it's time to give it a review.   A large part of my hesitation was based on how disconnected my feelings were about the food to the star ratings they had accumulated.  I kept waiting to be wowed,  and find an item that I found cravable.     The only item I found that I really enjoyed was the crab rangoons.   The wrapper is fried just right,  has a great crunch,  and the filling has good texture,  not just one note cream cheese.  Also their dipping sauce pairs well.  After that everything becomes either average, or below...   The first time I came here I got their chicken satay. While it was tender the amount of peanut sauce they give is very stingy.   It is also more of a curry base and less of the more creamy coconut some places have.  The cucumber salad is also more liquid then salad. Last, but not least several bone fragments were in my chicken,  which I have never had anywhere.  I found it odd so I contacted the business,  and I will say they have very good client recovery.   They apologized,  said this was an isolated incident,  and offered a free chicken satay to prove so on my next visit.   They also threw in a free rice and Thai tea.   I was impressed with their customer service. Also,  thank goodness never have I had another bone incident.   I also made sure the other times when I ordered on line to ask for no jalapenos in my salad, and they were always great about modifying. Still flavor wise I prefer Thai houses chicken satay.   I found their Tom ka soup OK the first time I went when I got it with tofu,  however when I got it with chicken the second time it was to salty,  and the chicken had a weird texture.   The pad seew was really disappointing,  no dimensions in flavor, and the second time it looked like they cooked egg seperatly and just tossed it on,  so it was not coated in the sauce,  just super weird. Their was another flat noodle dish that my boyfriend tried it was on the spicier side, so while the flavor was good a 3 out of 5 was to hot for me to eat more than a bite of.  So keep in mind at least that night they  definatly ran Thai hot. I normally like thai tea to cool down the the heat,  but theirs is to sweet,  and not very flavorful.   They do have a vegan menu which I know some will appreciate,  although I have not tried it. Also,  one of the reason I gave so many chances was they are open about an hour later than most Thai places near me. I really want to like this place more,  maybe I'm not ordering what they are known for.   Until I figure out what that is I'll just keep ordering here when my normal spots are closed.

1GRWhgDvFpny4Afn7kbQZg.text: First thai place I've eaten at in Vegas. Location and atmosphere is very nice. Customer service is excellent and they refill your water constantly!  Me and a buddy ordered the crab rangoons, thai tea, beef pad see ewe (level 4 hot) and drunken noodles (level 5 hot). Flavor was not bad but spiciness was way off - my level 4 wasnt spicy at all and my buddies level 5 was only slightly spicy. I understand every person is going to be different in how they determine spiciness, but if you ordered the highest level of spicy at a THAI restaurant I expected something with at least a decent kick to it. Crab rangoons were only okay.  Overall the food wasn't super impressive and the spice levels were way off, however the service was great. I wouldn't mind trying this restaurant again but will definitely be visiting other thai places before heading back here.

an9W3gvOsIvOQgxNolnKsw.text: A few years ago, there was a place here called Taiga serving up Thai and Japanese. Then they closed and were replaced by what we have now.  Tonight, I finally tried Table Thai Bar & Bistro, the "new" restaurant at this spot. They're much more focused on Thai food, with a little overlap into Chinese cuisine and possibly Vietnamese, and they seem to have impressed several of my Yelp friends. One of my friends from the Taiga era pulled up the listing when I said that I wanted to go somewhere new to write a review, although I probably would've insisted on something a bit fancier if I'd realized this would be my milestone 700th.  Then again, I've always liked the more affordable and approachable restaurants, which Table Thai definitely is. They have two televisions that were set to Monday Night Football on ESPN, which tonight so happened to feature my hometown and favorite team the 49ers. The music is quiet piano/instrumental stuff, which is relaxing and not at all bothersome. The servers were good and kept refilling our water.  Since I was aware of the lunch specials, I deliberately avoided ordering items on that menu in anticipation of getting better value on possible future visits.  For an appetizer, we shared Duck Rolls ($8), which is basically two fresh-tasting spring rolls w/ duck meat and a delicious sauce.  For my entree, I picked Pad See Eiw with beef ($10), which is definitely among the better renditions of that dish and has plentiful beef, some egg, and... wait, normal broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli? Well, it still gives the right veggie crunch, so it's not a terrible substitution, just an inexplicable one. My chosen spicy level of 1 (out of 5) was fairly subtle, and heat-tolerant eaters probably won't detect anything.  My friend ordered Crab Fried Rice ($15), which had tasty crab meat and fresh cherry tomato among other ingredients. He got it with a spicy level of 2, which was very noticeable but not sweat-inducing for me. It's not too greasy as far as fried rice goes, and I could see myself ordering it again after having had just a couple of bites.  We also shared a dessert, namely the seasonal Mango Sticky Rice ($7). Fresh, sweet mango and hot, sweet, glazed rice balls with a slightly crunchy topping (plus a couple of maraschino cherries for garnish) definitely hit the spot.  Yes, there will be future visits to Table Thai Bar & Bistro. It's a good (albeit very dim at night) restaurant with plenty of menu left to be explored. And yes, there will (hopefully) be 700 more reviews to come.

xSPtMvzS4NoEaZyQDNOYfQ.text: Oh my gosh! This is the second time I have ordered food from here. So delicious! The first time I had Jade Curry and Shrimp Miso soup. The shrimps in the soup were huge! This time around I ordered the Shu Mai steamed wontons. They were so flavorful and hearty. The best thing I have eaten in a while was the Kai Kua noodles. SO FLAVORFUL. The noodles are so soft and tasty. It is like they melt in your mouth. It's weird but a really good weird. The chicken pieces were huge and the calamari was good.  Two thumbs up!

Dg2AhaDwKSHx9KG8rb-l4w.text: My friend just flew in from OC and she specifically was craving Thai food. We chose this spot based on the reviews and proximity to Mccarran Airport. The waitresses here were awesome! They were nice and provided great service.   We ordered pad thai, jade curry, and papaya salad (spicy level 3 for all of them). I am Korean and like my food with a lot of kick. Spicy level 3 was enough to get my lips to tingle a bit. I am not a thai food connoisseur, but this place was pretty darn good. It was just as good as, if not better than, some of the good thai places that I used to go back home in OC. My friend who is very picky seemed to like this place so that must mean something.   The prices were not that bad and the portion size was enough to feed 3 people. The thai tea here was also refreshing (not too sweet).

a200LauyvAKiD0dh14HMbg.text: I really do like it here. The place feels very nice to have a meal in I mean the decorations and furniture make the place feel very inviting and comfortable. The only critique I have is again I'm sorry but when it comes to Thai food Im very picky about it so for me to give a 4 star rating means they are good enough to come back to. b8UOLPAYNcPLzSlqOovyZw.text: Let me start by saying I am by no means a Thai food expert. We had the Garlic Lamb Chops, Yellow curry, pad thai and the Asia sample platter. The Garlic Lamb Chops were easily the best lamb chops i've ever had. It was juicy and super tender. The yellow curry was rich and full of flavor. It was loaded with chicken that was perfectly cooked and juicy as well along with carrots and potatoes. The Pad Thai was simply delicious! The Asia sampler had egg rolls, satay chicken sticks, fried shrimp, dumplings, and cucumber relish. Everything was full of flavor and if it doesn't have enough to your liking, they have a platter of delicious dipping sauces.   The service was superb, they even box your food for you. They were super welcoming and the cook even came out front to see how we liked everything. You can tell they take pride in their cooking.  The atmosphere is the best and the lighting makes it even better. Very good for a date night out.  All in all, i had an amazing experience!

iBedgebLiLsJlBA4jkSAEw.text: The server forgot our app, did not inform us of an added ingredients even when a we asked her to clarify what was in the dish. eIuhHCa-HT8Yiu4ZV2wgtQ.text: I love Thai food, and I had to stop in Vegas to get my Thai food fix. The staff was very nice, our drinks were always full, and our food came out quick. tVpwUmNrbw8cVGgnIgMGqQ.text: Best Thai food in Vegas. Seriously!! I go about once a month yummy  Tom Yum coconut soup extra veggies, fresh mint spring rolls, red curry.

aQGazfNaucCb0_CVGDqnKA.text: I was craving some thai food but did not want to drive far from home. Luckily, this resto is near our place and my wife and I stopped by here for lunch. We ordered the following:  Panang Soft shell crab $13  Curry puff $7  Thai Iced Tea $3  Mixed Veggies with Beef $7  Everything was great! The soft shell crab and mixed veggies dish came with soup, rice, and salad. As another reviewer said, the portions they serve is just right and its a good deal. Their lunch specials run about $7-14 which is great. The crab in curry was awesome. I was happy also to have been asked by the waitress beforehand how spicy I wanted it. My wife's dish was tasty too. The curry puffs were tasty as well. It had potato and vegetables with some curry wrapped in pastry. It kind of reminded me of indian food too. Overall, I have to put this resto in the top 3 thai restos alongside Lotus of Siam and Arawan Thai Bistro.

uqPB3CuBM_L302Y7vsGK0g.text: It is very unfortunate that I have to change my review from a 4 star to 1 star. When we first tried this place out, we were in love. They have the best spring rolls I've tried throughout town, and our server was very sweet. After the past two experiences I have had there, it pains me to say that I'll never come back.  Food - still good. It's nice that they add a separate vegan section to their menu, and the spicy herb bed tofu was very different and flavorful, but when I order a 5 out of 5 and was able to eat it with no rice and taking only a few sips of water, I'm not trying to be a badass. You are doing something wrong. However, as far as flavor goes, it is very yummy here.  Service - This is the entire reason we will not come back. One of the servers there, whose name I can't remember, and I am sorry for that, is awesome. She's shorter than the other servers that I have seen there. She works very hard for her guests and has a very friendly, open attitude.  The other servers are horrible, all of them. Their hours are posted as closing at midnight, but if you show up at 11:20pm, they announce that they're already closed, will seat you begrudgingly, make you order before youre even sested, toss your food onto the table, and rush you out of the door. It is a horrible experience for someone who walked in 40 minutes before they close. Not 10 or 5 minutes. 40, and we were one if four tables in there.  But every restaurant gets a second chance rule, which is why we came back. We had our awesome server, and the only complaint was the food, until right before we left. My friend had walked up to our server to hand her a cash tip, and another server interrupted her and snatched her cash out of her hands. Look, I am a server. I know how things work behind the scenes. I can spot which servers actually care and which servers are low and sheisty. She, who was the same server that rushed us before, was sheisty. She didn't even serve us and yet she still grabbed, actually snatched it from my friends hand, a tip from another table? Argue that they may split tips, it is still very, very rude how she handled the situation. As a regular customer, I don't think I've ever felt so uncomfortable and unappreciated.  Thai table lost 4 customers who used to dine there weekly. I would suggest looking up Komol for a more authentic, spicy, innovative thai food experience with friendly service.

vC4ViqyimDhDgITyXJ0WVw.text: This place is seriously the greatest Thai food I have ever eaten! Great ambience, great service, delicious and aesthetically pleasing food all at great prices!!! The servers were super attentive and nice my drinks were never empty. And they were always smiling. I will 100 percent be coming back here as many times as possible!!  Anna, may, and Cindy were amazing!!! Great trio!!!

yV3-e1my0guq9fBg-zDwiA.text: This is an amazing Thai place, small and modern with amazing service.  Food was exactly as it should be, legitimate Thai food. Huge portions, enough to feed two people. So be prepared to share and have left overs.   Ordered pineapple fried rice and green curry.  They rate their heat on a 1-5 scale, based on other Thai places I've been to they usually say 1-10. I'd say "2" is like a 5 on the heat scale.    I will definitely be going back here in the near future whenever I need to get my fix, especially due to its close proximity to sunset park.  Great date spot for those that would want to go to the park and walk around to talk afterwards.

_m08xiNXkWnLZLAc2VpoPA.text: Best Thai place in town. Always good to eat in or take away. Even delivery never lets me down. Delicious and consistent.

r85lTPmlFKGHvPLy49y7EA.text: I love love love the employees and I love the atmosphere and the green curry is so good. I get all vegan here and they're really good with that! I go out of my way. Just to come here. I will drive 40 minutes. To come here. I love it so much

ceHM7IVzEA15QoANa1-hhA.text: I tried this today for the first time and was excited due to all the good reviews. I was quite disappointed in their tom ka khar soup, the broth was very oily, tasted like it was full of butter and that was where it derived most of its taste. I then tried the chicken mixed veggies since this is a simple dish that should show their ability to make a broth. They gave me tofu mixed veggies and again the flavor was pretty lame and the sauce very oily. Would only eat here if I couldn't get to my favorite Thai places: weera tha and David wongs pan Asian.

hIjI8l6_bR8SwAnbf5tTOA.text: A bit Americanised...pad thai was a bit bland, no fresh chilies, some strange red dye too.  Serve lemon vs lime which is not authentic.  Thai basil chicken was over filled with bell peppers and no taste.  Service was good but the food was lacking in authentic flavors.    Will stick with Penn;s Thai House down Sunset near Gibson.  Truly authentic Thai....

A_0y0qJh54YZNmDQ6CLFYA.text: I've been here many times, and my experiences have always been positive. The food is always great, with strong flavors and a large variety of options, especially for my Vegetarian friends. Their Tom Yum soup is great, and I usually get the large for lunch and have the leftovers for dinner. There's also a great selection for lunch time specials. The only reason I have it at 4/5 stars is because the service is a bit slow, so you have to know beforehand to give enough time if you are eating lunch there. Definitely a repeat restaurant!

qN3dW6oD9Ndv23H8xYA4AA.text: We decided to try this place being it seemed new and we like Thai food and compared to other places it was ok.  Some items were kind of bland and tasted different then what was expected.  We have eaten at many Thai places in Nevada and other states and most of the time you find the taste you are looking for or expect compared to your visit at other places.  This place uses a lot of HOT spices which for me was good, but others with us on this visit are not fans of spice.  They ordered the Orange Chicken and the Sweet and Sour Chicken which are two items I am a huge fan of and I don't know if it was the breading or the sauce was different, but they thought it was ok to not really liking it.  I tried it even though it is not on my list of approved foods to eat right now and I even thought is was less then ok.  The breading was very soggy and did not have a good taste to it and that goes for both chicken dishes.  This is a place we probably enjoyed trying once but will not be on our list to visit again.  There are other places which are just a few steps better and worth going back to.  Sorry to say this is not one of them.

hYJOhy0clKJXgXZl4GSOFw.text: This place is beautiful the music is great the service was great. The food is amazing I highly recommend the vegan curry even if your not vegan it's so good. The proportions are great they will fill you up. I never write yelp reviews in fact this is my very first one I had to because this is literally the best place I've ate at ever hands down. Highly recommend this place for anyone that's in town

JIAZy9iPpujHz7lcMbYX6Q.text: "Excellent Food & Services". Cozy place to eat. Food presentation like a "5 STAR Restaurant" at an Affordable Price. 100% Tasty Food Satisfaction . Friendly crews like Patty & An. Owners are down to earth.   Definitely and Highly Recommended Thai Food in town...

f4be_Wa5PfEFDZ8tY7P5qw.text: Ate in this go round & I must say it was much better. Arrived a little before the cut off time for lunch & was greeted pleasantly. Ordered BBQ chicken & yellow curry (medium spice) came with soup & fried rice. Excellent meal !! Arrived quickly & was fresh & hot. I recommend..

oVnHpz_ALAuZt6Qp2mP-qw.text: I used to eat here all the time until one time me and my boyfriend got sick and were pretty sure it was from something we ate there based off of the time period. However we were not positive, but it was enough to keep us from coming back. So tonight I was in the area and felt like pad Thai. I decided to give table thai another shot...I was initially shocked when I was charged 12.99 for vegetable pad Thai Togo. I would have never ordered it had I known it was going to be so expensive...by time I saw the price it was too late because I had called in to order Togo and they never told me my total before we hung up. I suppose that's my fault for not asking...I left a $2 tip because I am in the service industry and everyone who works here is super nice. So the vegetable pad Thai was pretty bad...it smelt and tasted like fish and they gave me lemons rather then the limes I had requested. I couldn't even finish it, so I gave the rest to my mom.  Without me even saying anything about the fishy odor and taste my mom mentioned how it smelt and tasted like fish. She thought there was fish in it. Now that to me is pretty gross. For the price and quality I won't be coming back again.  NOTE: after checking the menu just now I have noticed the pad Thai is only $10...still over priced for bad food, but I will be calling and demanding to be refunded and charged the correct price. I'll never come here again. Done.

1BqZV33VlheWMcE5COOKRg.text: Came here for dinner tonight.  Elegant interior and decor, great customer service, but I wasn't too impressed with the food itself.    This is a small restaurant.  I arrived between 5:45 - 6:00pm.  There were very few people there, but I was okay with that.  The seats had style and were super comfy.  This is the place to go on a first date.  We ordered the wonton soup, Pad Thai, and Crying Tiger.    A small bowl of wonton soup is $6.  They deliver the dumplings, veggies, and shrimp in the bowl and pour the broth from a mini pitcher at your table.  Very unique way to present your wonton soup.  The flavor was quite different because it had a sweet flavor to it.  Overall, the soup was delicious, but I'm used to the traditional unsweetened and salty broth flavor.  The soup includes pieces of chicken, shrimp, bok choy, carrots, and ofcourse, wontons.    The Crying Tiger is slices of grilled ribeye for $12.  It came with a side of small (I think some kind of chilli oil) sauce.  It was a bit dry and on the bland side.   FInally, the Pad Thai.  It was a bit on the greasy side.  The Pad Thai was big enough to share.  The server didn't ask how spicy we wanted the Pad Thai, so that's probably why they brought it out with a spicy level of 0.  The taste was pretty bland too, but it's nothing that Siracha or hot chilli oil can't fix.    The ambiance is nice, the presentation is nice, but the food itself tasted a little bland.  Overall this was a good experience, but it's not my favorite Thai place in town.

_wXZjbRDFErLJyG-8WueJQ.text: I absolutely love this place, its a cute small restaurant, seating is limited, but its such a popular place that its completely understandable (fills up face). QDwDAAqpcvD7xLWRGICtaQ.text: The location is pretty ideal, near a busy park (sunset park)and one of my favorite coffee shops in Vegas (sunrise coffee). We were excited to give this place a try.   The decor is nice and the seating is very comfortable. They have a few TVs on some of our favorite channels so that was a big plus. The waitress was very nice and quick.   The menu is pretty standard, and veggie options were pretty good. We ordered the vegan curry and fried basil rice with no egg and just veggies. They both came out relatively quick. The curry was a pretty small portion and we were both confused about how a veggie curry could be more expensive than the meat and fish curries...(minus one star) the mushrooms were really cold. Which was weird, because everything else was steaming hot. The curry is standard mild spice so make sure you ask for more heat if you like it spicy. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't super great. Over all, they have some awesome lunch specials that both of us would be willing to go back and try, but as for dinner and the price, go to komol or Nitayyas. They are also still waiting on their beer and wine license, And since it's a bar and bistro, I'm knocking them a star for that. My boyfriend liked the Thai coffee though. Give them a try and make your own opinion.

Table Thai had a variety of options as well as were willing to customize my food to my liking. For example Pad Thai is traditionally made with both egg and a fish sauce, which I do not eat. BVLw3YheuYC4ft4sphImIg.text: Absolutely amazing Thai! This place exceeded our expectations and then some. Our food was still hot on delivery, very well packaged and even had a little drink holder to make life easier for delivery drivers. We got the Crying Tiger, Pad Thai Thai, Tom Yum, Egg Fried Rice and Thai Tea. The spicy Thai sauce that goes with the Crying Tiger is amazing, I thought it should be more spicy though! ulFRKI6ocK39U55OpWc8RQ.text: Table Thai is my go to spot for lunch in Henderson. They offer lunch specials that are good for pick up or dining in.   I always get the Pad Thai lunch special for $7. It also comes with an egg roll and a salad! The portions are big! Especially considering that it is a lunch special.   I recently ordered through Yelp and I was surprised by how fast and easy it was! Everything was ready to be picked up in 10 minutes, despite them being busy when we got to the restaurant.   Other dishes that I've tried include the soft shelled crab panang curry (also offered during lunch if you feel like splurging a little!) And they also offer vegetarian dishes that are so good that you don't even miss the meat. I've tried a crispy tofu dish that was amazing!!   And for dessert, you must try their Thai tea crepe cake! It's so light and fluffy and not overly sweet.

TJQrL2FESYZxa6s6cFfmOg.text: ----------- Update Update! I was a bit frustrated with my food order the time I wrote my previous the posts. As I live across town and drive long distances for Table Thai's food.They took care of me & resolved all my problems. Despite having that lil set back, I will continue to support the location as the food is amazing, & they provide great vegan options! Great customer services from all the lady's that work there.

Z5nkwow51yxHDvAira4nyQ.text: I have driven by Table Thai so many times and wanted to give it a try. Last week I decided to call in a take-out order for lunch.   The woman that answered when I called in my order was very friendly. She said my order would be ready when I arrived and didn't even give an amount of time. It took me about 10 minutes to get there and my food was waiting when I arrived. Looking around the restaurant as I paid I was impressed with the inside of the restaurant. It has a clean, modern feeling.   The Pad Thai lunch special was calling my name. It came with a nice portion of pad thai (choice of chicken, pork, or beef), a vegetable egg roll, and a green salad. From the menu it looks like dine in lunch specials come with soup too. Even without soup I ended up having leftover pad thai for the next day. I really liked the flavor of the pad thai dish and the chicken. The green salad had a nice dressing and I enjoyed the flavor of the egg roll too. I would definitely order this dish again.  The lunch specials are an amazing deal. There are 16 different options for $7! Yes, $7! Even with tax and a 20% tip I made it out for $10. I can't think of any places in town where you can find a better deal for a quality meal. Lunch specials include an entree, green salad, vegetable egg roll, soup (for dine in), and rice (unless it's a noodle dish).   I look forward to returning not only to try more of the lunch specials, but to bring my husband for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai Lunch Special

AvlojF_kMZLpuMIccoN-CA.text: I've tried this place through UberEats and was pleasantly surprised.   I ordered the pad see ew and the noodles were pretty good. Good portion and the price was in par with other Thai joints in town. There was plenty leftover for lunch the next day which is always a plus.

afcqoUyq3stXQzclLmnV-Q.text: Went in on a late Thursday evening and it wasn't too busy. The crowd actually started to come in around 9:30pm as we were finishing up. Staff was friendly and fairly attentive.   We ordered pad Thai, shrimp fried rice, garlic and pepper chicken, and the Crying Tiger for dinner. The shrimp in the pad Thai and fried rice were huge and had a good serving in each dish. The pad Thai was delicious! The sauce had so much flavor - you could really taste the tamarind, fish sauce, limes, etc. and they put plenty of it on the noodles so they weren't dry. Definitely a must order! The fried rice was authentic Thai style fried rice and packed so much flavor in such a simple dish. The garlic and pepper chicken was the favorite dish of the night. The sauce on it looked so simple yet the flavors were so complex. It had the sweet, the salty, a bit of spice and tang. I would eat just that sauce with a bowl of rice and be satisfied. The Crying Tiger was our let down. It's a rib eye with a kind of spicy vinegar dipping sauce. The sauce was good but the steak itself was so chewy and was cold when they brought it out to us. Wouldn't order it again.   We also ordered a sweet roti and mango with sticky rice for dessert. The roti was perfect with a crispy exterior and soft, fluffy interior and was sweetened with just enough condensed milk. The mango and sticky rice was also good. The mango was ripe but had just a touch of tartness which matched well with the sweetened sticky rice.   Overall, most of the meal was spectacular and we will be back again, for sure.

ayJ7-fGMlSHAokxiKiiC2A.text: For as many Thai food places as there seem to be, it's hard to find good Thai food.  We'd driven by this place a few times and decided to stop in for a nice dinner out.  The decor is pleasing and the dim lighting makes it feel intimate.  It's a little thrown off by the giant TV mounted in the corner, but I know some people need that during their meal.  We got seated next to a decorative barrel, which I ended up bashing my elbow on several times.  I'm not an enormously tall guy, but the seating arrangement next to the decor was not doing me any favors.  The service was not promising at first.  There was one waitress for the entire restaurant and she was dedicating all of her time to the large party sitting a table over.  Once the other girl came over to help us, service improved.  My wife ordered the Spicy Basil with Tofu, which they unfortunately made with chicken.  Not wanting to be wasteful, she ate it anyway, because she would feel worse about the chicken going into the trash.  It had a good flavor, though not the best Spicy Basil we've ever had.  She also got the Tom Kha soup, which was super yummy.  I got the Crying Tiger.  The sauce was flavorful, though the meal felt like it was missing something.  It was just a bit too much "here's some meat, enjoy!"  It wasn't a perfect meal but it was promising enough that we'll be back.

It had regular barely steamed broccoli compared to most that have Asian broccoli ... I asked for extra egg, noodle and sauce and all I got was more dry noodles and definitely not more egg.  My shrimp miso soup was flavorless with three pieces of shrimp that tasted straight out of the freezer :/ I chose this place due to Grubhub and delivery fee being low :/

NhRY8zsggQ7z0Ji52VFYVw.text: Took my wife here on her lunch break this afternoon. This place managed to get us well fed and on our way in under an hour which is a pretty great accomplishment in itself.  But that was the thing that impressed me least.  This restaurant is a modest little space tucked away in retail center that you might miss if you aren't looking closely. The parking lot is tight, and often full.    I'm not sure why, but the restaurant only had a few other tables when we were there during the peak lunch hour on a weekday. I can't really complain though, the place was quiet and provided the perfect atmosphere for an afternoon lunch date with my wife.  The place is impeccably clean, and well put together. The decor is less like a traditional Thai restaurant and more like a modern bistro you'd find in an urban restaurant district.  We had two different servers waiting on us, making service as quick and efficient as we could hope for given the circumstance.   I love Thai food, but I can't say I've been the most adventurous when it comes to the menu at most restaurants. Poke fun at me if you must, but I usually get pad Thai, garlic string beans, or basil chicken.   I tried the pad Thai here, which proved to be an excellent choice because it was one of the most enjoyable renditions I've ever had. Not too soft, with a bold, well-balanced smoky  flavor.  I'm not sure why, but I always request the highest spice level (5 at this restaurant), and Thai restaurants never deliver the heat. As with every place, the server asked me if I was sure if I wanted it so spicy, and when I said "most definitely", I was brought a mild dish. Maybe they've had too many past experiences where people have requested full spice and couldn't handle it so they didn't want to risk having to remake any more food. I don't know, but when I say I want it hot, i'm not playing games!  No worries though, like all great places, Table Thai has a spice assortment of powder and sauces to kick up the heat of the food to your liking.  My wife got the yellow curry chicken, which she seemed to love, and while it did look delicious, I don't enjoy curry so I can't comment on the flavor of her dish, except to tell you she enjoyed it immensely.  They serve an excellent Thai iced tea in a mason jar glass, which adds an interesting touch to the classic drink. Very nicely done!  The food and drink portions were enormous, especially for a lunch special, which is an impressive $7 meal that includes a soup and salad.  The only item I didn't care for was the soup. It was a little light on flavor in my opinion: a simple broth/onion soup with broccoli and a dumpling. I almost feel bad griping about it because it came with my meal so I didn't pay any extra for it and my wife seemed to really enjoy it.  Overall, I think Table Thai is one of the best Asian restaurants I've tried so far in Las Vegas and I'm so glad we found it!

CTTSn6eODbYTX28GbYwkxA.text: I've had table thai a couple of times. I usually only eat here during lunch cos my workplace is so close. I come in around 12:30-1 & it's pretty packed. I've had better at other Thai places. I've also tried their pad Thai before & wasn't impressed. Maybe I just haven't ordered the right thing?? I really want to like this place since it's so close to my work lol. I don't wanna venture off too far. Maybe I'll keep trying different menu items.   The customer service is definitely 5/5 though! They're very attentive. This also might be because their space isn't that big.

3vAO6CpT8Aji08hdgQYsyQ.text: Nice little spot with great ambiance and staff is very friendly. Vicky my server guided me over the menu and asked what i liked and made recommendations. The crab rangoon is some of the best and i had the crying tiger sirloin very spicy and tender.

HfdXQ_xObMCNUut5zETMrw.text: We have been coming here since they opened and the food/service/cleanliness have always been consistently wonderful.  Even carry out is always top notch.    I have found it hard to find Thai places that are consistent in their spice levels, but the folks at Table Thai always get it right.    Some of our favorites over the years: Pork Larb - the menu only shows chicken, which is yummy.  But you can ask for pork if you prefer.  The pork is still juicy and the larb has the right amount of lime juice.  I like that they provide lettuce leaves to eat it with.  If I had to make a negative comment, I wish they provided more lettuce leaves. Panang curry - We have had this with pork, chicken, duck, and tofu.  I prefer it with the tofu, hubby prefers the duck, and the kids the chicken.  The curry is wonderfully rich and a perfect balance of veggies, protein, and spice. Jade Curry - This is a lighter curry than the panang and always so tasty.  We prefer the chicken or pork but have even had it with beef.  Always a good ratio of veggies, protein, and spice. Yellow Curry - the menu describes the dish with dark meat chicken.  Prepared that way, it is delicious with huge chunks of juicy chicken.  But you can get it with other meats, my son prefers the beef. Crying Tiger - This is the only thing that I think the portion size is "small" on.  All the other portion sizes are big, even huge.  But this is definitely a "single" serving.  It is the only thing we have never had leftovers of.  Great spicy sauce, but they will serve it on the side if you prefer. Stir-fried eggplant - This is one of our FAVORITE dishes.  Even my children/friends that don't like eggplant love this dish.  It is not what you might expect, because each piece of eggplant is individually battered and fried (very light delicate batter).  We always get it with tofu.  Perfect balance of sweet, spicy, salty... so yummy. Orange Chicken - Not what you think of when you think of orange chicken.  This is not the heavy over sauced version you normally find.  Instead it is light and refreshing, but still filled with orange flavor.   Pad Woon Sen - again, many restaurants use too much oil in this or are too heavy on the noodles vs everything else.  This is perfect flavor, ingredients, texture of the noodles. BBQ San Set - I like this because you get a quarter chicken, sticky rice, and papaya salad.  The chicken is so flavorful and moist, and the papaya salad is a welcome light refresher. Fresh Spring Rolls - This is the best version of spring rolls I have ever had.  Again it is about the ratios, some places put too much noodles or lettuce.  Some don't provide enough dipping sauce or it is too thick.  Most places don't put enough shrimp.  This is the perfect balance.  Other choices, hubby loves the crab rangoon.  We all like the four seasons (i think that is the name) as well as the duck wraps.  Tom Kha Ga is huge, we are always too full to eat our food when we get this.    We also like the Lad Na and the Pas See Ew but again it can get a little heavy since it has the wide noodles and it is hard to not eat it all.    I don't think we've ever even made it to dessert because the portions are so big and the food is so tasty.

H5ao6zd9BqOR-rmoAC0fEw.text: Went here for dinner with some friends after taking my exam and I have to say the food here is pretty darn good! It's located in a small plaza and has a dim, sort-of intimate atmosphere.   I ordered the pad thai with chicken and shrimp which looked really good because it had a nice glazed appearance due to the tasty sauce (I hate it when places serve pad thai that looks dry and dehydrated!). I also got a good amount of shrimp (more than 3 pieces!) and chicken. Check out the picture to see for yourself! The quality of the dish as a whole was delicious and I would say it is on par with Naga (although my friends prefer Naga a bit more than here). One advantage this place has over Naga is the fact that their portions are bigger so you get more bang for your buck.   I would definitely come back here if I am craving Thai food since I had such a good experience. The staff is nice and attentive since they kept refilling our waters without having to call them over. The prices aren't bad and are worth it because of the quality and quantity.   Check this place out if you get a chance! I will keep you guys updated when I decide to go back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and shrimp pad Thai! It tasted as delicious as it looks xD

-OtaIojSPOJCTmyFx_wuXg.text: First off I ordered food through the eat 24 app. It was quite convenient.   As for the food, I got the wrong soup. I ordered the Tom kha and got something else. I called to let them know and they informed me they'd resolve it by refunding me the money,  but I never got it.   The orange chicken was not good. The chicken was thinly sliced and battered but not saucy or crunchy. It could be because I had it delivered so it had time to get soggy. The chicken is fried and served with a side of orangey dipping sauce.  Not great.    I do plan on ordering from there again because it's convenient and I believed in giving a place more than one chance. Hopefully the next one will be better

2q42PmeNWKO96rfA_iWAKA.text: First time here and I can say this is the BEST THAI FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD. Greeted and seated right away. Interior is more modern, low dimmed lights. Which made it more luxurious, rather than your typical Thai restaurant decor. Our server was very busy since it was Mother's Day but she was awesome, attentive and very kind. I ordered papaya salad and spicy basil. Thinking it would be chopped Thai basil but it wasn't. Either way it it was delicious, flavorful and spice level was on point! This is definitely our new Thai spot.

VmQePiK1L25weyLwLQfcrQ.text: This is a great neighborhood place to get authentic Thai food.   When we come here, we can always count on the following: Great options, delicious (and large) Thai tea, CLEAN environment and great service.   You never have to wonder where your servers are, as they are politely attentive. As for the food, the quality of the meat is important to me and they meet my standards! No rubbery-ness that you find at some other Asian restaurants.  We have tried most of their curries, and many of their noodle dishes, but the pineapple/shrimp curry (if I'm not mistaken) is my favorite.  Also, they deliver and it's just as good at home!  I would say this place isn't good for groups larger than 6, as the setting is a little more intimate so space would be an issue. Great date night place, though!

o3yY-krsIZ4O_2Ay4qfxhQ.text: Casual & cute restaurant hidden in a small strip mall off Sunset. My date and I stopped here on our way to Galaxy Theatre, only ~2 miles away. eiBbd70JUYxiTYfRDm9lTg.text: Ordered Pho for delivery. After an hour wait (I'm starving at this point), I open the bag & I received everything but the noodles! Called the delivery guy back & he was kind enough to bring the noodles back which took an additional 30 minutes. The noodle portion was the smallest I've ever seen & the quality of the beef was poor. My boyfriend & I started with Tom Kah with tofu, it was very flavorful we loved it! My boyfriend ordered the Sea Curry with brown rice, it so freaking good!!! I ordered Drunken Noodles & it was made perfectly. Our waitress was very sweet & she coursed our everything perfect. I would much rather dine in then order out!!

6-OlCvmXoY1yphobaElXpQ.text: We had the pineapple fried rice, was a little spicy so ask for no spice but was delicious & had ginger w/ chicken would have this once a week & never get hired of it!

hm9Oi2vi5nQZyn7UZsKpwg.text: We needed something fast, but not necessarily fast food. We decided to order some Thai takeout because this place was located nearby. We ordered through yelp and our pickup time was 20minutes after. Not bad. We were unsure of the size of the lunch specials so we ordered an extra dish. We got  1) panang curry was thick and creamy, very flavorful   2) pad Thai tasted different, but good. The chicken was perfectly cooked  3)orange chicken was decent as well.   The portions are definitely on the large side.we were only able to eat half of each entree and we were decently full.

whqBvZlEUBr1zRTXCMpN5g.text: This place is great. Everyone is super friendly and accommodating, and the food is delicious. We go here once every 1-2 weeks.  Would always get the crispy spring rolls and the drunken noodles with soy chicken because they're the best things we've tried...until the other night. Tried the curry puffs and Pharam Long Song just recently and they're super tasty too (curry puffs are a touch pricey for the amount I feel, but they probably take a lot of work to make). Highly recommended!  They're also open later than pretty much every other Thai place, which is a HUGE plus as good late night spots are hard to come by.

4fK-xSrdDTvt2ZjOu6KSJw.text: Friend and I came here for lunch and we were starving. They close at 3, but we were able to get there around 2:15. Two large parties were leaving when we arrived.   Although the restaurant is on the small side, it's nicely decorated with comfortable seats. I remember seeing 2 or 3 TVs. We were given water right away. We decided to go with the orange chicken lunch special ($8) pad Thai lunch special ($7) and pad see ew ($10) because we thought the lunch special portions would be small.   They started us off with a small bowl of vegetable soup that had one wonton in it. The meat was pretty tough so I didn't really care for it but the broth was flavorful and sweet... ( I'm hoping there isn't a bunch of msg in there). My friend really liked their soup.  Our food came our quickly and the orange chicken portion was pretty big. The pad Thai portion size was smaller and the pad see ew portion size looked ok, but we were too stuffed to finish anything. The spiciness level in both noodle dishes were supposed to be at a 2 (out of 5) but I felt that that pad Thai was more of like a 3.5. I had to pick out a bunch of (fresh) chili pieces out. Also, the color of the noodles seemed to be very... orange. I wasn't a huge fan of the pad Thai. However, the pad see ew was delicious! Best pad see ew I have ever had. It was perfectly seasoned with a hint of sweetness. Also, the beef was super tender. My friend enjoyed her orange chicken and also really liked the pad see ew. Next time we come back, we will be ordering pad see ew again.   Service was great. Our waters were constantly being refilled and we didn't feel rushed to finish our meal before their closing time at 3.

tk1iduQ7IxGZvedV1I-GbQ.text: Ordered $30 of food via the YELP app. Easy and smooth transaction. Delivery was timely. Panang Curry was good. P9UbBS6z6OmBLOwjWbObGA.text: We have eaten here before and the food was good, however not so on 12/7/16. The staff is friendly , but the cook is slow. We ordered Tom yum soup that was so overpowered by lemongrass that it was inedible.  Also the drunken noodles tasted ok , but were swimming in oil.
