lTgVQvNkb9rJfTLZe3LkjA.text: Went 3 times in one week...crazy delicious, great service & close to home! My sister had soft shell crab panang all 3 times...I originally picked it because it was close by & they had vegetarian & vegan options which were very tasty! This is my new Thai go to place!!!

CppoYs71-bxeLa0B2bTpTw.text: I am a HUGE thai foodie. With that being said, I found Table Thai through Yelp, quickly placed an order for delivery and was very satisfied with what I got! Upon arrival the food was still warm as if it had come straight from the kitchen onto my dinner table. The driver was very nice and even gave me some free thai iced tea for ordering delivery.   Food:  - The first thing i got was a yellow curry. For the price it was a bit small portioned but really satisfied my hunger. The sauce was excellent and had a bit of a kick to it (i got a medium) and had a VERY generous amount of meat in it. The flavor was excellent as well as the consistency; not too runny, not to thick. This came with your choice of white or brown rice.   -Second, I ordered the pad thai. Once again this was on a scale from not spicy-spicy. I got a medium but the flavor was not spicy at all. Anyways, the noodle were very flavorful and all around good. They came with chicken, bean sprouts, green onion, egg, a lemon, and peanut topping.    -Thai Iced Coffee. Enough said. It was absolutely amazing.   -Thai Iced Tea: Simply amazing. Wow.  Overall, this was the best delivery thai I've had. 5/5 would order from here again.

9gBTHGaK_THMxcjazXWffQ.text: This Thai Food restaurant has a great decor and atmosphere. I've been here a few times with friends and have ordered it delivered. I enjoy the panang curry, pad see ew, and curry puffs. My only issue is that a #5 spicy (1-5) is not that spicy. This place charges a bit more than other Thai restaurants in the same area, but the quality, service, and decor are leaps and bounds above nearby competition.

TE8lp-gYsvERSbKY_-he8A.text: We ordered from the Vegan menu. Yes they have special Vegan menu. We ordered roti with green curry it came with bowl of rice. It was delicious roti was crisp. Next we ordered pad Thai noodles with vegan sauce. The noodles were little oily but the taste was very good. There was no room for desserts but we inquired and they have or can make 3 out of 5 desserts vegan. Something for next  Time.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Pad Thai.

dHKGU0mdVZu9yNiOoKO88Q.text: Wow! Great service. I did not have to wait at all for a drink or refills the whole time. The food was amazing and very beautiful presentation. I definitely recommend this place.

N-oss-DjmIn1TPmxOTWvEQ.text: This was a pleasant surprise. I was on my way next door for coffee (*rise) and as I parked I thought, I'll just have a late lunch (2:30). From the outside, this place is much understated and truly unimpressive but as you enter, you immediately realize the owner put a lot of thought into making this place comfortably chic and more upscale than most Thai restaurants.  The venue is well lit, large windows with enough tinting to make it very comfortable and clean. I cannot emphasize enough how clean the place looks.    Lunch pricing is lower than average at a great value of $7-9!!  This is only reinforced by the more than reasonable portion size.  This place reeks of great value, at least for lunch.  Considering this is my first visit and my first review of this restaurant, food-wise I would only read into this "lightly" until a couple more visits.  The food came out within 3-4 minutes of my order. Therefore, on the onset, service is awesome, the kitchen fast (perhaps too fast--I'll explain later), the staff very engaging and attentive; giving you enough space so as not to crowd the guest and are "invisible" in a positive way.  They filled my beverage (tea/water) without notice.  The disappointment - this is the gist of it. After all we go to restaurants to eat.  Therefore, if the food isn't what stands out over the ambiance, then the place is just, okay.  The brown rice was sticky and pasty; a clear sign that it was past its time in the rice cooker.  My order was as basic as it can be for a first time visit--Broccoli Chicken.  As I mentioned earlier the portion size was generous, at least 8-ounces (easily 5 oz of chicken).  The chicken was cooked well.  The vegetables, soft and over cooked.  The flavors over all were spot on; sauce was delicious.  Here is what I suspect they do in the kitchen: the base -- veggies and broth sit in a pot. They flash cook the meats (chicken, beef, pork or shrimp) per order and throw that into the base at plating.  This unfortunately makes the cooking unbalanced.  Say what you would about the P** W** chain but, theirs is cooked to order.  All of it, to order, each time.  Therefore, the veggies are not soggy and it only takes 3-4 minutes more.  I don't think anyone would balk if the kitchen takes 10-minutes to put out your lunch order. After all you can pass the time with the soup that comes with the meal anyway.  Also, the salad greens were Iceberg lettuce instead of a leafy mixed green which has more nutritional value but hey, it is under $8!! This place would better serve their customers if they par-cook the veggies or just keep the stock separately and compose the ingredients upon each order.  I'll give this place another couple of tries for dinner and perhaps with a larger group to experience it on a better day.  Every establishment is entitled to a bad day.

8FhQD6yXX3qpp_TcpfczeQ.text: Absolute worst Thai food I've ever had & I love Thai food.  Got chicken yellow curry & it comes w/dark meat chicken.  You have to request white meat which is cheap.  And sauce wasn't very flavorful.

ZgB2oafW9AX0xsN4q5FyEA.text: I have to write a follow up review because I had delivery again, but tried new things. Slightly disapointed in what I got this time.  Orange Chicken: Sauce was extremely delicious, had little bits of orange peels in it and great flavor. The chicken pieces were extremely sub par though. It was deep fried and breaded- but I couldn't taste any chicken whatsoever. Only a couple bits had even a noticeable piece of chicken in it. After about 5 bites the novelty of the great sauce wore off and I realized I was just eating deep fried bread with orange sauce.   Sweet & Sour Chicken: Ordered in order to take to lunch the next day. Same deal as the orange chicken. Extremely small to non existent chicken deep fried in too much breading. I ended up just throwing it away because of how unappetizing it looked after the orange chicken.  I recommend staying away from these two options as they are $10-12 and have little to no chicken in them. Very disappointing.

OTRBDuKoLBOB02lDej7jRQ.text: I do not understand how this place gets higher stars it has to be the decor. I walked in and thought wow this place is amazing. Sadly I ordered the Pad Thai and it had no flavor very bland. My friend ordered teriyaki chicken and it was mostly chicken skin. I will never give this place another try! YUCK

rzllAaK6a5F7jmt56eAb7w.text: I ordered several items, and they all have too much sugar in them. I don't like my savory dishes sweet one bit. Thank God the calamari tasted like calamari.  Will stick to other Thai restaurants.  Plus the delivery took over an hour.

x7HjQTo55W-g3QCreTWRHw.text: My wife and I came here tonight for dinner and we were quite pleased.  The atmosphere was very nice, with lovely jazz music playing at a reasonable level.  I ordered the Salmon with Green Curry and it was delicious.  It came with a side of brown rice and its presentation was quite nice.  My wife had the Pad See Ew with Tofu and it was also quite good.  Service was very pleasant and prompt as well. Now the kicker is that halfway through our meal the electricity for the whole block went out ad the staff came up within minutes with candles to provide light on the table and nearly every staff member came to apologize even though it was clearly not their fault.  Then when I discovered I had insufficient cash (since their credit card reader was not working on account of the electricity being out) they said we could just pay next time we came!  I insisted on leaving my credit card numbers so they could charge for the bill.  Even though the power went out we still had quite a nice meal (although we were definitely liking the music they had playing).  We will definitely be coming back to try some of their other dishes.

mdCoAL54Y9_UrG0oZvjgPw.text: Excellent fresh Thai basil rice!  Clean nice staff and quiet for lunch.

vJiUE5PpR4sdrgcUaCcu3w.text: Cute little place to hang out.  Friendly & quick service. Foods are awesome.. We'll be back. Thanks Table Thai!!

YXJFOgdEzawwZPKefksStQ.text: I eat a lot to Thai food, this place was the best Thai food I had by far. I would recommend everyone go and try it out

NaLqb59gBAdoauU-Z2dDnA.text: This place is awesome! I went there tonight with my boyfriend and his family. We were all impressed with the quality of the food, which was all delicious and expertly prepared. We were also impressed with the service, our waitress was funny, friendly, and very attentive. I can't recommend this place strongly enough!!!

UIjU4utKKdkhk4cKJhufYg.text: This is got to be one of the best Thai restaurant  in Vegas !!!! The quality of the food is  incredible  :))))

rdVZU7KNmvQBSPImrYuBog.text: lamb panang curry is a game changer! the best curry  I've had in Vegas. so flavorful it's unreal. this will be my local Thai spot just because of this dish. it's pricier than typical curry dish at $21 but it's worth the try. also, the thai iced tea is huge considering the price is only $3. overall good food and will be back. it's only 4 stars for now because I haven't tried enough of their menu but the will change as I will be back!

vWohG8577_s3FGmD-KlM5Q.text: I often order Pad See Ew when I go Thai and found Table Thai's to be almost inedible.  The tofu was cooked until rubbery and the cloying sauce overpowered the noodles and egg.  On the other hand, it seemed like a friendly place with lots of regulars so obviously they're doing something right.  I loved the location, close to my off-airport hotel.

xWSq_wXx88d4AiOsxEDW2g.text: I ordered the papaya salad, tom yum soup, calamari and summer roll. They were all delicious. So much flavor and great service and ambience. The prices are very good too. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer roll
Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad

oNg8O9vXtKZB8N3GTGf2lA.text: My partner and I wanted Thai takeout for dinner and thought this one was the best we've tried so far in our area. We live about 10 minutes away and always pass by. We ordered the pad Thai (level 7) and mixed veggies with shrimp in brown sauce.  The pad Thai was good, but it was a serious 7 and almost too hot for my taste buds so somewhat hard to eat.  The mixed veggies & brown sauce was delicious and something I'd definitely order again. Our food was ready before our initial pick up time also so that was a plus since we arrived early!  If I'm craving Thai again this will be the spot but I'll be sure to take my spice level down a notch!

qJ0vdFoQR3Rpxyg8Yr8aEQ.text: I have been here twice now and have not been "wow'd" either time.  My first impression was that the food was just mediocre, the restaurant isn't very comfortable feeling, and the service was very awkward (the waitress stands to one side of the room and just stares at you to see when she should come back to your table).  That first visit was well over six months ago, so today I decided to give it another shot. I went in for lunch and there was only one other party in the restaurant.  A woman waved to seat me but I was not able to understand what she said so another lady came out and seated me.  This is a very sensitive topic, but I feel that you should not have people in a position to take orders for food if there is that strong of a language barrier. Mind you, English is my second language so I am not trying to sound rude to English learners in the least. I just think it's not right (to the employee or the customer) to have somebody in a position where they really need to be able to understand, and yet they cannot take an order or have a basic exchange in English. Example- The other table that was seated asked for an iced tea. The lady kept asking "hot iced tea?". To which the gentleman at the other table tried not to seem rude as they were explaining they just wanted iced tea. Again, someone that spoke better English had to come out and get the order.  Today I ordered vegan pad Thai. But honestly, it was more like stirfried glass noodles with some veggies added. It was OK, but not what I had ordered. And the salad that came with was room temp. Room temp lettuce is not appetizing.  Then of course there was the girl that was circling me and took my plate and napkin away before I was really done.  I've seen the other reviews on here where people rave about how good the food is. I have had plenty of Thai food in my life and I cannot rave about either of the two visits I have had at this restaurant.  I don't think I will return -as today's visit cemented my first impression.

MdZFcnVA5BMYLpWS3eisyg.text: There is no way this Thai restaurant is rated 17th.  It is, hands down, a top 5 Thai restaurant within 20 miles.  Their seafood curry is as good a dish as you will find anywhere, except maybe Lotus of Siam's whole garlic fish.  It is very small, maybe 12 tables, but worth the wait, if there is one.  Try it out.  You will not be disappointed!

Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

87SjB5aisBul_NN0cfs8Ww.text: The energy of the management and employees here is unmatched. The next best thing that makes your food taste even better is the great customer service. I had such an amazing experience while dining here with my friend. We got some Thai tea to drink, vegan wings, and more. The food was a 10/10 for me. I am definitely recommending them to all my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 Shu Mai

t9bDa24lP5ZNbyNbbDXKWw.text: I love love this place. The Vegan curry was not super sweet and when you ask for a 4 you get it. The Vegan larb was also awesome. They're by no means a Vegan restaurant, but they have a great little Vegan menu to choose from. I'll definitely be coming back to this spot.  Service was great as well.

NS_ju9fCjLt53klOhNP-Rg.text: It's very hard to rate a Thai restaurant on one visit, but this place is very comfortable and hip to eat at. The staff welcomes you immediately during lunch time as they are busy and eager to serve as many as they can. They do a good job in delivering service and turning tables.  I ordered the penang soft shell crab lunch special and the BBQ pork plate. The crab penang sauce had too much peanuts for me, but it was good. My favorite was the BBQ pork because it was delicious based on it's tasty marinade. I definitely will be back to try some of my basic Thai favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork had an excellent taste from the marinade.
Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penang soft shell crab, lots of peanuts.

q_Hm3KcSloPmeaCWMu-zhQ.text: Finally found a Thai place in Vegas that I can easily give 5 stars, and only after one visit!   Fantastic food, good portion sizes, and fair prices for the quality.  -The cucumber salad was awesome, fresh and came with lots of onion, carrot, and pepper. Not too sweet but instead just good spicy flavor. -They gave me a complementary seaweed salad that was great. Peanuts onions and more. If not on the menu yet you should ask for it. -My pineapple tofu red curry was one of the best I've ever had. Full of flavor with onions, pepper, basil, bay leaves. You can add the complementary little chili flakes, chili paste, and jalapeno for a major kick. It didn't need the add-ons, I took a few sips of the broth and nibbled through it I wanted to enjoy each drop.   Great service! Patty is a legend! I was greeted, seated, and brought water quick. Got my very good and large ice tea fast which comes in a glass mason jar. I was already stoked at this point.  The kind server asked if I had been there before, I said no, and she was actually happy to offer suggestions and go over the menu. She asked what I liked with a genuine smile on her face the whole time and you could tell she cared. Many customers got hugs when arriving and she got told I love you from several people! Haha.   I'm so happy this place is by my new house and can't wait to try more things. I'll be back often for sure. If you are not close just make the trip and check them out.   I appreciate Patty and the yelp community for helping me find this place. Thanks and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3T8EO8vq5ZuLzwOLDTolTg.text: I'd like to share the following about my recent delivery order from Table Thai Bar & Bistro: * Asparagus Shrimp:  On the restaurant page, there as an item called Aspargus Shrimp..it is described as "shrimp, shitake mushrooms, and carrot in delightful brown sauce". When you select that item it prompts you to pick a protein... shrimp being $3 we assumed that meant extra shrimp was $3 since the description already included shrimp.  So  we chose the chicken which was free. Food arrives, no shrimp in the dish. Called the restaurant and they said if we wanted shrimp, we were supposed to select it and pay $3 extra..... on a dish called asparagus shrimp, in the description it lists shrimp as one of the ingredients. They refused to rectify the situation And will only bring a shrimp dish if we pay extra, and then blamed postmates. That is just not an acceptable way to treat customers and after years of ordering there, will never order there again.

T3OHTJWr5x0NfBKpP2av8A.text: Ordered to go using the yelp it. How convenient is that, my card is already attached and I can check my order status right there in the app.   Love the menu selection, vegan options were available. Spicy level 1-5 on most dishes. They were accommodating with editing my order and omitting things we don't like.   The food was fabulous!  Really hit the spot. We ordered crab fried rice, pad Thai with ground pork and a small Tom yum soup. With delivery fees it's was around $45. The servings were quite large. There were huge chucks of crab in the rice and it wasn't imitation. Pad Thai was very flavorful and lots of ground pork. Tom yum soup was my favorite out of the order. 3/5 spicy was the perfect amount. It had So much chicken and mushrooms. The broth was infused with lemongrass like usual but it was stronger than normal which I love.

UICx5F3bjY4yfSKaLqxGcA.text: I think I've tried every reputable Thai Restaurant in Henderson by now.  Table Thai takes the #1 slot for me. Everything is absolutely delicious and their selection of Vegan options is massive. Make it during lunch time and be treated to soup, salad, and the main course for a very affordable price.   My favorite Thai dish is yellow curry. Wow it's just so good here, perfect thickness of the sauce and the most fresh ingredients. Let me also say the peanut and ginger dressings here are easily the best I've ever had. I also love how the serve the soup first, it really opens the palate.   Shout out to the servers and cooks here. They are so friendly and really make the experience better.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FWfZGOA6oeE5q49p_TnyNA.text: This place has been one of my favorites for a long time. Small family owned restaurant that makes you feel welcomed and at home. It doesn't matter if I'm eating in or ordering delivery, the service is always spectacular. The inside atmosphere is amazing with great music and decor.   My favorite meal is the Spicy Eggplant. The peanut sauce and sticky rice are also delicious and I can never resist the Thai Tea or mango sticky rice! All appetizers are good as well, I always eat something new when I come in! The prices are reasonable and great portion sizes.   Overall this place is a must eat at. Definitely recommend to all my friends and family. Thank you for the amazing memories and Thai food!

gQGpadviPrPMSo1wR5CeSg.text: I came in tonight by myself around 5:30pm got seated right away. I can tell this place is a little more american-ized which isn't necessarily a bad thing. I have a rule with thai places your either a pad thai or a curry very few do exceptional at both dishes. I decided to go with the pad thai thai for $12. At first glance i thought this is not going to be enough food and i came hungry! but to my surprise it was very filling. I got a spice level 2 and it suprisingly had more of a kick then j expected but, it was just right for me. It had both chicken and shrimp which is a nice bonus, although i only got 2 shrimps and few bits of chicken. my overall thought was that it was good. something is missing i can't quite put my finger on it but overall i would come again.

YOuun1fxd-F50L_vDfAh0Q.text: My husband and I love this place we get take out all the time and it's seriously the best Thai food in Las Vegas

LN4pboOJnOj3EWb03y2udw.text: Table Thai was very accommodating for the large party that we had. We had a birthday dinner and they were kind enough to go out of their way to get balloons to decorate the table (upon request).  FOOD: Their food is not as traditional in taste, but they have everything Thai Dish that you might crave for. I specifically like this restaurant for their Roti with Curry. If you don't know what it is, guess you'll have to order and try it!  ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant has this vintage vibe to it that makes it great to go out for a date or meet up some friends for dinner. The restaurant is pretty small so there are times that you have to wait. I suggest calling ahead to make a reservation. The seem to do a lot of togo orders because there are constantly people walking in and out of the restaurant.  SERVICE: The staff here is very friendly and is willing to make sure you enjoy your meal. They don't have many servers so you'll have to wave them down if you need something.

dMDBxvWJTXRmLzBZjBptRg.text: Love this place,  Small, cute , GREAT FOOD. If your looking for a nice chill place with good Thai food look no more your going to love it!

UosOgtPm-Gv5zw0wM7p30g.text: I've probably been here 6 or 7 times total and the last two times there were issues. Yesterday during lunch it was busy so the three of us lunch gals got a big table and ordered promptly. 2 orders came out with about a 5 minute delay for the third order, not nice since being polite is waiting until all three of us can eat. After we were finished our plates were cleared and we waited a very long time for our check, we actually had to wave someone down despite the rush being gone. Typically it wouldn't be a big deal but a lunch rush is just that because people have to get back to work.   The time before that, I was also on lunch with a different friend and I laid with cash. The lady brought my payment back AND the change so I made money for eating there. Of course I have the money back and told her but there wasn't much appreciation. Perhaps they need to have more staff during lunch due to the recent issues. One thing is always consistent.....the food! It's always great but service is huge and it seems to be going downhill. :(  Excellent pad Thai, spice level 3 was just enough to make my nose run but not enough hurt my stomach. The presentation was lovely, the service was perfect and I look forward to coming back on another lunch break in the near future. My coworker loved his beef salad with added shrimp as well.

5RUlugzQHAOUdm-M-FY6ew.text: Excellent Thai food with plenty of options as far as flavor, meats, and level of spiciness. They also have vegan friendly options, more than I've seen at other Thai places. The staff are always so wonderful and greet you happily as soon as you walk in. They are so attentive and friendly, I look forward to seeing them just as much as I do going for the food! The presentation of the dishes are always so pretty and they always make sure to check on you, making sure everything is exactly to your liking. I recommend the pad si ew, the drunk noodle, curry puffs and the mango sticky rice! Can't go wrong here, delicious food and excellent staff!!

XNubfngPv0rs9ms8yakvrw.text: Reasonable prices and amazing Thai food. I've come here for lunch and even late dinner. Food is great and always on point. I love spicy food and a 3 is pretty spicy for me. I usually get the roti with green curry and curry puff. I wish they gave more roti with the serving because I like dipping it in the curry. Other than that it's a great go to for easy and quick Thai food.

oRkwf_OYaArxWzfYbqCLpA.text: The Thai samplers ( chicken satay, fried coconut shrimp, steamed shiumai ) with special sauce each was tasty and truly appetizing! Must try the lamb chop - doesnt have a gamy taste and its perfectly medium grilled. I have been exploring the best mango  sticky rice in most Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! By far, Table Thai created the best dessert in town. The sticky rice with sesame seed cooked in coconut milk blended with mango puree on top was too die for! The freshly ripe  mangoes with cherry on top compliments the authentic Thai dessert . I thought the good was great and affordable . Patty provided excellent service and great recommendations on the menu.

My only other problem with Table Thai was how thirsty I was after the meal!  Also, no hard alcohol. Limited number of beers and wines. ALSO, turn up your AC!!! We were burning up in there!

znMcc5lz1M_tRsoaMZalwQ.text: Good atmosphere, I really enjoyed my Kong Pow Chicken. The host and waiters were very present and polite. The cook was also in and out of the dinning room checking on orders. I was pleased and will definitely return.

yO06bZEIL-4rUu-4PkNTMw.text: I am very happy to find this place. The restaurant has a very nice and relax atmosphere 5/5. Decoration inside is modern and classy 5/5. If coming with friends or family or bringing a partner on a date night,  you would not be disappointed.   Most small Thai Restaurants offer just ok food and average decorations. But food here is super!!! Not only food looks so pretty yummy 5/5 but the taste is also delicious 5/5. Today, I started with Crying tiger. The sauce is so gooood 5/5! Then Spicy hot basil spaghetti and Panang Soft Shell Crab are next.  Wow, I've not seen these menu at other thai places. These ones looked amazing 5/5 and are very tasty 5/5!! My friend also had vegan orders; Roti with Green curry and Tofu Larb. Super yummy 5/5! People who are vegan will like it here, they can add soy protein or custom their orders. The restaurant also offers brown rice and variety options for health lovers! Final order is Mango sticky rice; it is so delicious 5/5!!  The service are exceptional, fast 5/5 and friendly 5/5. The quality of food and restaurant is outstanding 5/5. I recommended to everyone. You couldn't be happier. I will come back here again for sure. My next time order would be Duck roll and Clay pot... Can't wait...

K9Mx29xARiv9ZdOcqCC2pw.text: My favorite place. Beautiful and cozy place, excellent service (for me service is very important) and price is very reasonable! My son (3 year old) love this place!

XIKqJadPry5NNFK6V9SkYg.text: I love ordering food from this place. I usually order here once a week. Their delivery is quick and their driver is always friendly and nice. I used to order via YELP all the time, but the driver told me if I called in my orders, I would get a free thai iced tea. So far I've ordered their panang curry lunch special and E-San Set and their chicken and som thum is delicious! I love it!

UH07Edz16icIxyYqAB4xlA.text: I've been here several times, and it is resoundingly mediocre and overpriced.  The environment is elegant, dark, and freezing cold.  My sister and I have tasted nothing here that is above average, and the portions are small. Almost twice as expensive as my favorite Thai places in town.

ogJrT4b6EXwDF51-w0BGIA.text: How this place got 4.5 stars on Yelp! right now is beyond me. I came here with my dad one afternoon for an early dinner and the food was so bland, it felt like the greatest waste of money I've ever spent on Thai food. Granted, my family is Thai so we are more on the critical end of the spectrum.   Firstly, when I spoke to the waitress in Thai confirming whether their yellow curry noodles was "khao soi", she said it was so I believed her and ordered it, since it is one of my favorite dishes. My dad ordered pad see ew since that is how he judges a restaurant on how good this simple-to-make dish is. When my noodles came out, you better believe I was disappointed. The curry was too light and bland, with vegetables that did not belong in there and the noodles were almost like ramen noodles, not khao soi noodles. My dad's order was tasteless, missing key components of a proper pad see ew, like garlic and Chinese broccoli. I can let go of the Chinese broccoli because it can be hard to find depending where you live, but how do you forget garlic in a Thai stir fry dish?! Oh, I almost forgot, the noodles in the pad see ew were old too because they weren't soft as should be. Overall, this place was a huge disappointment and severely overpriced for the quality of food. Never coming here again and telling all my friends to steer clear of this place as well.   One added star for decor and nice tableware.

JwMHGUTbfaQtxk_4eHbVaw.text: This is the best Thai food in Vegas. No need to go anywhere else. Everything was super fresh & tasted great. Staff & owners were very friendly and attentive.! Great lunch specials! Lunch portions will leave you full & the prices reasonable. Had the orange chicken & it was so good.  Not a fan of egg rolls but I could eat their's all day long. The plum sauce is delicious.

r3PY0RiS3KnhOIAC6sqsKQ.text: Love this place. Food is excellent and customer service is phenomenal. I highly recommend. Order the Sticky Mango Rice for dessert. You will be back for sure.

3zZ3iviSEQssN6j4UC3H3Q.text: I like to come here for lunch. Big portions at a reasonable price. My favorite is the Drunken Noodles...enjoy

2xziZCcBeFl82ETD4lFRxw.text: Table Thai is very inviting. The atmosphere is pleasant, it is clean, and the food is delicious. A centerpiece of this establishment is Patty (unsure of how she spells her name.) She seems to thrive on serving and making everyone happy. She was zipping around from table to table, and I wish I knew what vitamins she took (ha ha).   Being my first time here and assuming they would get the order to the right table, I didn't pay attention (my fault) to what I was served, although a different server announced what it was as she brought it to the table. When I asked after a few scrumptuous bites if a spicy shrimp salad came with the salmon I had ordered, it was discovered that it belonged to the nice couple at the next table. I was told to keep the salad anyway no charge. Patty made sure the couple got extras to compensate for the wait, and the wife told me that Patty is always like that. When I had to have my leftovers boxed, Patty gave me fresh rice and a yummy, and as she pointed out, healthy Thai Tea to replace the regular iced tea I didn't get to finish. My order of Garlic Salmon was so yummy I will order it again (if you don't mind it being sweet, try it.) But I also want to try other items on their menu. This place is a little out of the way for me, but, believe me, I will make it "on the way!" Also, they offer brown rice!

w7LNbbGcoItxdRwQ8FkUXQ.text: Really excellent food. We had the Massamum curry and Pad Thai. Reasonable prices, good service, nice ambiance. We will definitely be back.

rz-BoEC815K-I9HeT1ucAw.text: Great food and nice decor. Close to the airport easy to find and the staff was very friendly and helpful. What more could want?

FC0L1n-4pjqyEUmsgkdLWw.text: Very good Thai food! We ate Panang curry with chicken and tofu, pad Thai noodles with chicken and tofu, and three favor fish! The customer service is A+++. 6v0W_odP8GZDpwpNYwCp2A.text: Updated Review: I've been frequenting Table Thai every week since my first review, and I'm consistently so impressed! Fresh, delicious flavors, great portions and great prices. My favorite Thai restaurant by far!

LTUwatDCtOOPzBJurxjUog.text: After a long day at the iheartradio music festival this lil Thai place was the culinary happiness of our time in Vegas. The owner was sweet and helpful with the menu. Our waters were constantly refilled by another server. They didn't miss a beat. I got the pineapple shrimp curry with a level 3 spice....it was beyond perfect the spice and the fresh veggies made my mouth happy. My boyfriend ordered an asparagus dish with mushrooms and shrimp. I tried his and the flavors were wonderful, very bright. For a Thai place it is delish and prices well!! Try it out for sure!

wlLUlVkNyWq4pk9SVdUS7Q.text: This place is a staple to our diet and our social lives.  Over a year go, we tried this place based on very positive Yelp reviews.  The food is amazing and you'll enjoy all of the normal staples that most people learn to love when it comes to Thai food.  We elected to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here and let me tell you, that was an amazing event.  The owner and staff went out of their way to host a wonderful multi-course meal all while having a very fresh atmosphere that all of our guests really enjoyed.  We were able to order a bunch of different menu items that many folks had never tried before.  Not only was the event a lot of fun, but the resturant has opened our eyes to many other Thai dishes that we might not have tried in other places.  Our family continually returns to a thoughtful staff that serves great food.  Give this place a shot and try the Larb!

RXuXk1fB0LS2CDRUp_o1lw.text: Table Thai and Bistro was a fast and easy delivery experience. I ordered the Spicy Basil Fried Rice, the Pepper & Garlic Chicken, Pad Thai and Spring Rolls. The rolls were fresh and crunchy and the spicy basil fried rice was to die for! The pad Thai was better than most places I've had and the pepper and garlic chicken was moist and delicious. The man that delivered our food was extremely friendly and personable. I will definitely order from Table Thai again!

lC-TAFVteWLzPXZozzipcA.text: Yum! Great food, friendly service, and nice atmosphere. Prices are very reasonable. We'll be back! Good drunken noodles and cashew chicken. Fresh roles weren't my favorite.

fGt6jGLG3FIE7KevFwkoWQ.text: The place is great! I have no complaints. The Sleepy Duck is fantastic. You have to try it. Service is great and it's really clean...kind of a hidden gem

0mBb1srMFnMlVa0JDG9Frw.text: I order from here all the time, The lamb panang is amazing! Best curry I've ever had.  They ran out of lamb and gave us beef, it was also delicious. Tom ka is great and we loved dipping the roki  bread in the panang. My favorite thai place besides lucki thai.

gdIA5LsX0CUnksIoxcNNAw.text: 4 stars for my first visit.  The next may boost my option to 5!  Much better than we expected for a quick lunch stop.  Each dish was excellent and the soup was too. The service was good and the furnishings were a pleasant surprise.  Don't let the strip mall type location fool you.  This place is great for Thai

trYzeOBbJU5fWHJLq3fHFw.text: YUM... Nice vegan selections, + there are options for tofu in the fried rices & some other dishes. I got the tropical tofu, which was delicious! The tofu was fried but not greasy or thick, it came out perfectly. Jade fried rice was my favorite.  My friend got the green curry with roti, and I had to try it, AMAZING! I'll be getting that next time.    This place says it's a bar but they don't serve alcoholic drinks, kind of bummed because I really wanted a beer or glass of wine to wash it all down :)

Very cute decor including the cute lil coconut drinks served in actual coconuts. Not a huge fan of lamb but I must say they have a garlic lamb chop dish that is to die for. oOPnk-cuBomfpFphjUhfIQ.text: This place is a hidden gem. Food is delicious and consistent. Ordered take out 2 times and dine in once. Service is excellent. Restaurant has a super cute atmosphere. Lots of vegetarian options. We will be eating here often.

TIb6ehOnHWRipm4F0bPDOg.text: I've been here a couple of times before the restaurant gained popularity on Yelp. I loved it before. It's such a cute, little modern place. It's clean and nicely decorated. The staff is very kind and gives great service. The food was good too.  Tonight, however, I ordered the crab rangoon, beef salad, and pad Thai. The crab rangoon was good, always one of my favorite dishes to eat. The beef salad was too sour. Almost too sour that I couldn't eat it, when I love to eat sour! The beef on the salad was so tough! The pad Thai was overly sweet and the chicken in it was also very tough. I did not enjoy my meal at all and neither did my boyfriend. I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of the food. I don't think I could come back after this visit, which makes me sad because I like the atmosphere and the service.

VtinSmxeReOXuwSnlrgN9A.text: The food was delicious and the service was great, just a little pricey but well worth it

1xQQzgC7hiQIR8EgHXFvBQ.text: Good Thai food. Quick service. Great options of you are vegan. My husband and I are vegetarian (not vegan) - we got the pineapple fried rice and the green play salad. Both were good. The waitress informed us also that their food doesn't contain fish sauce or oyster sauce and it's all vegan sauce - very unusual for Thai places.

nuv_Z--rk4VDVDzSpkQ9KQ.text: Great food excellent service, my Thai friend just order a bunch of different things and it was awesome. The waitress Jenny is so pretty there too!

GlhZbkuEmoIX2aFkjzyfag.text: Needed some nice spice tonight. After reading reviews chose here. Glad I did. Great food, friendly staff. Will be back and highly recommend

uZhHV9F-r8Vx7tUm1aSK4w.text: I just ordered online through Yelp and had my food delivered. It was so easy and convenient. The food was amazing. I ordered the yellow chicken curry(spicy). Just a heads up, I love spicy food and this was definitely spicy but not too spicy to the point where I couldn't eat it. This was honestly one of the best chicken curries I have ever had, it was so flavorful. I also ordered a Thai tea that was really good, I love Thai tea and could not resist. I also ordered the Kung Pao Chicken for my boyfriend, and it was also just as amazing as the curry. The portion sizes are also pretty big so that is a plus because I can save the rest for later.

QfUgIQ6pwFDnej8DG1QPgg.text: How quickly things change! Very, very disappointed to hear that Chef Troy left the restaurant because he discovered non-vegan ingredients were being served to guests as if they were vegan. Sounds like someone was taking shortcuts; however, for vegans, it is vitally important that we are able to "trust" the menu. My husband and I will not be back to this restaurant.

vI-ouE6bqInp-AqysQIi3Q.text: We have been to Table Thai Restaurant several times.  The food is delicious and healthy. They have vegan options as well.  The food servers are friendly and personable, as well as very efficient.  The atmosphere is wonderful for a relaxing lunch or dinner. We enjoy the lunch special.  We have had their red curry and mixed vegetable with chicken. Their duck spring rolls are delicious as well as their appetizer sampler. We also enjoyed the garlic shrimp with asparagus. Service is outstanding.

42EWXQWFWJHcE5gCLUCEFg.text: Surprisingly exceeded my expectations. Tried coming here twice before with no luck; first time it seemed dead for a weekend so we were a bit skeptical and walked back out..second time the entire place was closed due to a private function...however, the 3rd time was a charm I guess. Had the usual Thai food; yellow curry, chicken pad Thai, fried rice, but something new...calamari and their crepe cake. Really, I just saw their crepe cake on Yelp and had to try it out! Each meal was very tastey! Be sure to add spice to it if you want some kick! Calamari was just right and their cake was delish! Wished I ordered ice cream on the side. Service was good, could use more than just one server. Seemed like the lady was running around doing everything from answering the phone, greeting, taking orders, serving and cleaning. She was very nice though. Ambiance was great! Clean and a nice zen feeling. Only draw back was they served the appetizer after our entrees came out. That's just a no no. But, I would come back for more!

Also, most yellow curries that I've had have carrots, onion, potato, and meat. This one was missing onion? I'd be willing to give them another chance, but for now unfortunately this is my stance.

SrACzvy0NjsyRa2rVutEiA.text: We have ordered food through bite squad several times. Unfortunately something always seems to go wrong with our order.  This last time my husband ordered two different dishes which usually come with shrimp to be made without shrimp. It was clearly stated on each item. No shrimp.  Veggies only.   Guess what gets delivered? Shrimp. So of course now there is no rating the food and he has nothing for dinner after waiting an hour    Additionally, I ordered a new dish this order myself, but kept it in the fridge and had it the next night for dinner. and have been ill all morning /afternoon following. I can't say for certain that it's related, as no one else ate it. But I didn't have anything else different during the day that I can associate this with.   I will say their food is delicious. But their following directions leaves much to be desired.  If you are planning to eat here, it seems you need to go there in person as they do not follow instructions when it comes to delivery.    I hope they can improve their delivery customer service as their food is good and it sounds like a cute place to visit. I like to support small locally owned businesses. But customer service is key.  They need to improve that area.

g2c3XvO3mn3AHTO99UyJKQ.text: Nice place to eat on a casual night. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. Tasty food but I took off a star because my food was semi cold in the center.

GkW8_fqU9uy05IxYL94mTA.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch a day or two ago. Very nice and attentive staff, fair price.  I found the food lacking. I ordered a level 5/5 spice panang curry. Perhaps the chef was having an off day, because I heard the girl sitting next to me complain about her yellow curry being thin and flavorless. With so many good reviews, I'd be willing to try again. However if I have another experience like my last, I would never return.

EcbQ6KKvVe6Otq2ygDP4bA.text: This place is wonderful. The food is excellent and it only competes with the outstanding service. There is a separate vegan menu, but just about anything could be made vegan. The food is just delicious!!! I had the vegan version of their Pumpkin Shrimp Curry (nix the shrimp, added the veggie mix) and omg . 7,000 thumbs up! The atmosphere is nice and relaxing. Fs6ekqR0DbbC-RhMlu8gtg.text: You're going to be impressed.  I tried the panang soft shell crab lunch special and wow!!  The curry was impeccable.  Soft-shell crab!  That's such a delicacy and Table Thai makes it an affordable luxury.  All lunches comes with a yummy wonton soup and a salad.  Ask for no straw with your water to help save the planet. lc7DEL3Q65VD0lhFIGbr6Q.text: I love this place! New to the area and happy to have found them. Mostly order it for delivery and it always comes hot and delicious. If your in the mood for Thai this is a good place

zZ-4yuHG5FHQMVFNxPu6SQ.text: We had a rough day at work and wanted to try delivery service from neighborhood restaurant. Everything was so smooth and easy via yelp. I clicked on the items I wanted and dinner arrived in less than an hour. We ordered fried soft shell crabs, basil fried rice, duck curry, grilled ribeye (crying tiger) and Tom yum soup. All tasted flavorful and fresh. We are very satisfied.

30pOFMp0aGDAiijNGo0aAA.text: Came here on a whim and due to craving some thai food as well. My friend and I were in the neighborhood and thought we'd try it out. It was around 8 or 9pm on a Sunday night and when we came in, it was pretty busy. The place isn't the biggest and it was a bit dark though. I liked the ambience and atmosphere, very relaxing. Everyone working was nice and I felt they truly care about their customers. Always asking and checking up on us to make sure things were okay. Anyways, our waitress greeted us as we came in and directed us to our table. We ordered three dishes: The Duck Roll, the Drunken Noodles with Beef, and Tom Yum soup with Shrimp plus our drinks: Thai Iced Tea.   Out of the the three plates, I thought the Drunken Noodles was the best because the noodles weren't too soft or hard. The noodles were cooked at the right amount and had a bite to it. The sauce wasn't too salty or sweet; however, the overall dish was a bit oily (but that's most of the case with a stir-fried Asian dish). The portion was sufficient enough for one person.   The Tom Yum Soup was good, but there wasn't anything special about it. Plus the portion was a bit small for what I thought was a large size. I'm not sure if the waitress misheard me, but I was surprised if that was what they call a "large". By the way, since we called for shrimp, it was a $3 extra cost. However, the soup was well seasoned, not too sour with just the right amount of sweetness. Other than that, it only had the broth, mushrooms, and shrimp.   Lastly were the Duck spring rolls. This was a bit disappointing. There weren't much duck meat, but rather more veggies instead. The dipping sauce it came with was good, but again nothing too exciting with this appetizer.   I like the Thai Iced Tea. It came out in a Mason jar mug and was a lot. There are some Thai restaurants that can be very cheap with the portion of Thai Tea given. Many even water it down or put a lot of ice to make it seem like you're drinking a lot, but you really arent. This place DOES NOT do that. So for $3, I thought it was reasonable. The drink was a bit too sweet for my taste, so next time I'll just let them know to lessen the sweetness. :)

_n0PLo5ZsGTa99uVi__OfA.text: We went to this restaurant due to good reviews but we were the less fortunate ones. We were seated at a very small table. I requested for a bigger table but the waitress won't heed. Thus, when our appetizer ( we ordered a sampler) and 3 entrees arrived ( Phad Thai, Panang curry, BBQ Chicken and Cat Fish) we don't have a space !!! Again, I requested for a bigger table and that's the only time  the waitress who was talking Thai to the other cashier accommodated our request. Irked with the waitress attitude and vapid taste of their food except for the panang, we left not barely touching their Phad Thai. I have my doubts why this restaurant won the Best of LV Thai Restaurant. Thai BBQ and Lotus of Siam remained to be my top two Thai places to go to. Live and learn ... I guess.

lp4E9Lvs673qkPpCa9dMHQ.text: The vegetarian options I've been hearing about at Table Thai is what drew me here and they did not disappoint!  On recommendation from a friend, I ordered Pad Thai with "spice level 2" and no peanuts (allergy).  I was delicious and I can't wait to go back.  Their service was great, restaurant is beautiful, and service was fantastic.  Immediately after we got our food, employees were constantly checking in with us and keeping our drinks filled. They're very aware and accommodating of both allergies and dietary restrictions.

FvrsjD_zuljMUPP-PF854g.text: This is a smaller place but it is nicely decorated and is open till 11pm. The service was fantastic. Our server was knowledgeable and offered great suggestions. They have a great selection of food and most can be made vegetarian/vegan. The food was incredibly fresh and jam packed full of flavor. We ordered our food at a spice level 3 which was great for me but a little on the spicy side for my boyfriend, so if you can't take the heat I would order a level 1 or 2. This is definitely a place I would go back to when I'm in the Henderson area!

hCs9ftbAZ3dfc4zXoKanvA.text: In town for business, and was looking for a casual and comfortable place to have a late-ish dinner that's not too expensive. Glad to have stumbled across this restaurant. The atmosphere was relaxed and the decor was modern and clean. I was the only patron around 9:30pm on a weeknight and the staff was respectful and attentive.   Here's what I tried: *Small chicken, shrimp and wonton soup, $6.00: really tasty but sliiiiiiightly too salty. Good enough to order again.  *Red curry with shrimp and (sweet potatoes?), level 5 spicy, $15:00: Really tasty with fresh ingredients. They made it "very spicy" as I requested, and still managed to keep it super flavorful.  I'd love to dine here again and try other dishes. Totally recommend!

MXlKQhy_28jJ6C4TnPEq0Q.text: This is my go to thai spot! I love the Panang Curry and Pad Thai. To the cook that made my curry today, it was spot on! I always call in for delivery and the delivery people are always very friendly. I've been ordering thai from them for about 4 years now :)

KEPY2R3gadh_QVFsTV9f9g.text: You know what I love? Being able to order my food online so I don't have to dial it in. Why? I occasionally get a little ordering anxiety - feeling the pressure - and sometimes things get lost in the shuffle.  I was next door at Sunrise coffee sharing a chocolate muffin with a pal when I remembered that Table Thai was right next door. Since I was still enjoying some quality time at the cafe I opted to order take-out directly through the Yelp app. YASSSSSSSS. Big win.  I opted for the Panang Curry with tofu which was my favorite dish. I'm honestly not sure why I went with tofu and not chicken but I loved the dish. The tofu was firm but creamy and the curry was rich with a hint of spice at 2 stars. I wasn't so much a fan of the Phad Thai and that's okay.   The order was ready for me when I walked in and the space was super cute. I'd totally love dining in but I'm in love with ordering takeout.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Pad Thai + Panang Curry. The curry is with tofu and it&#39;s amazing.

This is a small hole in the wall restaurant and ALWAYS busy during lunch time BUT that just shows how popular it is!

aE6-57UXz3t108_itCu_aA.text: We were going to the coffee shop next door, but decided to get lunch here first. We started reading the menu outside on the sidewalk, and the waitress popped her head out to make sure we didn't have any questions. We noticed they had many vegan options, so we went inside. The inside is very nice and cozy, with a romantic ambience and very clean. Perfect for a date night. The waitress was very nice. I ordered the vegan orange tofu, which was wonderfully presented. Portion size was bigger than I expected for the lunch price, and came with rice, side salad, and a broth soup with veggies. The orange tofu was delicious. Actually, everything was. Our waitress checked on us often, and gave us recommendations for vegan entrees to try next. We will definitely be back.

gsN3v3VQFxpvdGvP39aW7A.text: I ordered the Pad Thai with tofu for dinner which had a very good and traditional Thai flavor. It's so delicious. The atmosphere and service are great. The people are very friendly. They taking care of the customer. It's too cozy. The decor was a great creative and clean. It's awesome. Worth every cent.

CxVBlCLUIghC0vFVwjCAxg.text: This place is pretty new, at least to me. It's a little far from my house in 7 Hills and was cautious about trying a new Thai resturant. I was very happy I did! Had the papaya salad and was spiced perfectly. The the dancing shrimp and loved it. They have made me a regular.

GVNA93VQYmhHW2wc0ZkX1w.text: Visited on NYE. It seems to be in a commercial neighborhood, wasn't super crowded. The staff (Anna) was really attentive and gave great recommendations. We ordered a family size soup- simply yummy considering the weather outside was freezing; drunken noodles, papaya salad, spring rolls. Everything was really yum! Since we had a little more appetite we asked Anna to recommend something additional- she recommended the basil spaghetti but we wanted it with rice noodles instead. So requested that the chef get creative with rice noodles, basil and whatever else- the result was simply superb. Definitely recommend this and we plan to come back

PCx2NvACfRdJeI8kMuFfBw.text: To start off I'll say that once I pulled up into the parking lot, the exterior of the restaurant already caught my attention. Stepping foot into Table Thai Bar & Bistro amazed me, the interior of the restaurant was an outstanding sight. It looked very modern and the decor and furniture tied in with the modern culture of today's society. When the waitress greeted us, she was very polite and our first impression of her already gave us the perception of great customer service. Our first dish was an appetizer, Shumai and Papaya Salad. It was very fresh and delightful. Our second dish was an entree, Grilled Lamb Panang. The lamb being cooked medium, made the meat very tender and moist. The panang sauce matched very well with the exquisite meat. Afterwards, we enjoyed the Deep Fried Fish with Red Chili Sauce. We thought everything was amazing but this dish caused me to be ecstatic. The flavors were so splendid and went together so strongly. The deep fried fish was boneless and the sauce was not too spicy; the basil had a strong dominant taste that tied everything together. Last, but not least, don't forget to order their homemade Thai Tea. The sweetness was perfected and the tea was very delicate, but bold. Unfortunately, we did not order dessert due to all the delicious food we had eaten, but hopefully you try their desserts because I don't doubt that it isn't as amazing as everything else. I could doubtlessly say that everything from their presentation to the actual meal, was stunning. Overall, I savored every bite on my plate and every sip being drank. I could easily say that I will definitely be back to Table Thai Bar & Bistro very soon.

qirMCll__yAoGqkuo5pkiQ.text: Ate here last night for the first time.  We had the Tom Kah soup, Panang curry and Jade fried rice.  All the dishes were delicious and the service was excellent.  The soup was just a little bit spicy so they adjusted it to make it to our liking.  We will definitely be going back.

07erNWHF48Mqd-Dxlm-utQ.text: First time in Vegas and was craving Thai food. Yelp had good reviews and tried it out. Absolutely awesome restaurant!! Food and service both are fantastic! Staff is so friendly and helpful. I'll definitely be stopping here again on next trip! Yummy Tom yum soup.

JD5fsd46amFnJEb6XPJW5A.text: This place is probably one of my greatest disappointments. I was so excited to move close to a thai place that delivers but Table Thai ruined that almost immediately.   My husband and I ordered the yellow curry, garlic lamb chops, lazy duck, and mango sticky rice with thai tea to drink. The overall food portions were ridiculously small and over priced for okay flavor. The yellow curry chicken was the most flavorful dish with some spice but every other dish was bland and lacking. The duck needed sauce. The garlic lamb chops were tough and in need of spices. The thai teas were (in my opinion) way too sweet but when the ice melted down they were good to go.   All in all, I will only ever order desert and beverages from Thai Table and nothing more. I will not visit here or recommend it to anyone for a meal.  I honestly tried to give this little joint the benefit of the doubt and encourage you to do the same if money is no object and unflavored food in tiny portions is your deal. Your luck here is probably gonna be better than ours was if this is the case.

UXJRQTU99CDEIWJrBBTUrg.text: Went for lunch 8/9/16 around 12:45pm. Ordered lunch pad Thai noodles $7 add $2 shrimp and papaya salad $9. Lunch special came with a small bowl of soup with 1 wonton and veggies(broccoli, cabbage, green onions)5/5. The papaya salad tasted like it was tossed in that sweet chili sauce, Too sweet for my taste buds. Fresh ingredients but just wasn't executed like a papaya salad I prefer 3/5.  Pad Thai noodles was slathered in a wet red sweet sauce 2.5/5. (Strange that other posted their pad Thai looks different from what I had) Also had side lettuce with a sweet thick dressing, didn't eat the salad.   Overall this place was busy during lunch time and had REALLY good service. Food wasn't awful but just not "my" typical Thai lunch spot and everything tastes too sweet IMO. Maybe try some other dishes next time just not those items.

24iNGVQXFbd0Jg3Ca1t_Gw.text: Dancing Shrimp Salad, Shumai, Tom Ka Gai soup! We also had pineapple chicken fried rice and Thai iced tea!  Thai food is my favorite and I choose Thai wherever I travel. After doing my Yelp research, we traveled over 5 miles by Uber each way to go to this restaurant and it did not disappoint!  The food was fabulous!!! I never had Shumai before! A new favorite. The Tom Ka Gai was the best I've ever had! And the chicken pineapple fried rice, they took it to a whole new level!!!   Thai Iced Tea was great as always. Always too sweet.  My biggest disappointment was that we didn't have room for the sticky mango rice dessert!  Service was fantastic! Warm and attentive, clearly committed to excellence while treating you like family!  Two thumbs up!!

2oTQG_WqitzefynjWy9lVg.text: This place will get 5 stars from me, every time.  They have great vegan options. It took my boyfriend and I some serious convincing that the Orange Soy Chicken was indeed vegan because it tasted so real. So, so good.  Most places that substitute their main dishes with a fake meat alternative usually ends up too dry. Not here, they're fake meat is unreal. (No pun intended) Even adding soy chicken in with the yellow curry is really good, too. It's expensive, but you get what you pay for in my opinion. I never leave feeling like I didn't get enough to eat. I could drink 45 of their Thai Ice Tea's in one sitting.  And the garlic fried rice...I've legitimately had dreams about it. Don't ever ever ever leave here without having tried their freaking garlic fried rice.  Overall, the food is fantastic.   But the best thing about this place is the staff and the atmosphere. I would go in here everyday after work and they ladies that work here became some of my very dear friends. I never left the place without a hug and without having some good laughs. And they treated me just as kind when I was a brand new customer. I recommend it to all my friends who come in front out of town.  I love you Table Thai

6UALkIq4O9I39-N9EkjRTQ.text: My only complaint about this spot is that I wish it were bigger. It's such a poppin' lunch spot that I feel like if you don't get there early, you might be waiting a bit for a table, or sadly, have to leave (there's not a lot of space to wait).   I frequent this spot especially during lunchtime. They have a really great lunch special that isn't terrible expensive. They also serve every special with soup and rice. Their fried rice is scrumptious and full of flavor. Their soup - man, so dang good! I am not the most adventurous eater so I always opt for the teriyaki chicken, which I've never been disappointed in.  On top of the delicious food, the staff is always quite kind. I've never had a bad experience with any staff here. The ambiance is also quite beautiful with dark wood decor. It's extremely clean and beautiful inside.  Now that I think about it, I know what I'll be getting for lunch tomorrow....

fwfQ9oDk3t4_y8RAzeXRTg.text: Found this place via yelp, the bf was picking me up from my grandparents and it was down the street. We both got the Thai ice tea, it was really good. We also got some spring rolls (fried) and the sauce that came with it, made them even better then we thought. I ended up getting the pad Thai, the usual when I try new places.. it wasn't that great. There was no flavor, barely any taste of peanuts in it and lack of veggies. I expected more, didn't get that.  Also the waitress was nice but didn't come around a lot, she looked like the only one taking orders. Place was busy too, would of liked to see more people waiting on customers.

I was here with friends a week ago and one of the group is newly diagnosed with siliac so he's not sure what he can eat. They patiently answered all his questions and hypotheticals.   Tonight I went vegan ordering the Tofu Fresh Roll and Spicy Herb Tofu with  a 3 of 5 heat.  Very fresh, abundant and satisfying.  Support you local small businesses.

-X8wLW4JO4GlEGPoAEI7JQ.text: Thai foods-very tasty and good. I know my spicy level is over the top, so I'm not rating on their spiciness. fresh and good tofu and mushrooms--tom yum soup was hot and serve on the fancy hot stove so it was boiling while we ate with our noodles/rice.   however, customer service was lacking. after we sat down, it took about like five minutes to come back to our table to take orders for two (and that one night, it was only us two plus two girls at other table, so it was not a busy night at all). after ordering, it seems like it took forever for our foods to come out. good thing our tom yum soup boils as we eat. I don't know why but we were ignored the whole entire time we were there. I tried to get the young gal attention cause she likes to walk back and forward across the bar/center and stop after the fact I saw that she doesn't care about our table. I can see that she was quite busy with the phone calls in between work and her cell phone. there was two Postmates orders that came out and out. also, one walk in for take out.  I want to try their Thai tea crepe cake for desserts afterward finishing our meal, but decided not to.   we just sat there and talked for awhile. no refills and didn't bother checking if we needed anything else or get the check. nada. it was exhausted night for us too so we didn't care much.   we won't be coming back, the vibe wasn't right. the foods was just average--nothing that stands out and nothing that I would come back for.

UUvdl-2azth2yTiEFo9GlA.text: This place was on my bookmark list for the longest time and I finally decided to celebrate my birthday here. We originally had reservations but when we got there, open tables were available for us to get seated right away. Atmosphere is very cozy and relaxed. Some tables were placed very close together!  My go-to thai dishes are pad see ew and a curry. We started with the appetizer sampler, which had pieces of chicken satay, shu Mai, spring rolls and coconut shrimp. Everything was delicious... but what doesn't good when it's fried?  We ordered the pad see eww with tofu and jade curry with chicken. Both dishes we had a spice level of 3. The spice kicks in after you really start digging in to the dish, but it was sooo good to not resist eating. The noodles in the pad see eww was very tender and thin enough to soak up yummy sauce. The chicken also thinly sliced and ask very tender and juicy. I chose the jade curry because I love eggplant, which I wish had more of! Either way, we devoured all of it.   Thai tea crepe cake was amaaaazing. The Thai tea wasn't too overpowering, which is probably why I ended up eating the whole piece to myself :)   Service was exceptionally fast and friendly. Our server gave us free white rice and offered again after we had finished our meal. She's so sweet. One thing I wish they had was more bathroom stalls. Regardless, I'll definitely be back again.

29m81ziMlAxGS1I-aTStRA.text: Overall: Table Thai has decent food, but some basic dishes fell very short of expectations.  Food: 3  Jade Fried Rice with Chicken: The flavor was good but the execution was lacking. The dish lacked the signature wok taste of good fried rice. In fact, there was no char on the chicken and the rice tasted almost like white rice mixed with curry paste in minimal low heat.  Drunken Noodle with Beef: Pretty tasty dish. We got a spice level of 2/5. This was enough for a spice wimp like me to feel the heat, but this will taste like nothing for seasoned eaters.  Service: 4  The waitress was nice and patient with our large group. Note that they will only take up to 5 credit cards.  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant has really nice decor, but the metal frame of the windows and AC units are jarring against the otherwise fairly elegant design. It's like a "high-end" Thai restaurant was shoved into an old fast food store front.

OnX2fQ71InEuo5OJLkXbNg.text: Food was excellent  Food was packed very well Delivery was fast.  Orange chicken Bbq pork  Papaya salad Sticky rice Brown rice  I would have given 5 stars if the papaya salad had more papaya than carrots, too much carrots in it.  But over all food tasted very good. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I_FTc8b7tJ6Ee4XN8xeNBg.text: I was in Las Vagas for the night and did not wanted some great Thai food and found that there are a lot of highly rated Thai restaurants in the area.  We chose Table Thai Bar & Bistro and had a great meal.  The food was great and the service was amazing.    We ordered the crab rangoon as an appetizer which was a great start to our meal.  These were not frozen appetizers that were thrown in a fryer, they were light, crispy and the filling was very flavorful.   For our meal, we ordered Drunken Noodles with pork and the Sea Curry.  The Sea Curry was a red curry based dish that was served with great vegetables like carrots, bell peppers, bamboo shoots, and onion which accompanied the shrimp, calamari, white fish and mussels. The portion was large and while we ate all the seafood we were not able to finish all the curry.    The Drunken Noodles were classic and full of flavor.  The pork was tender and delicious.  I have had a lot of druken noodles in my life and these were first class.  If you are looking for great food, a pleasant atmosphere, and great service and want to avoid the crazy spots in town then this is a great place to enjoy a great meal.

Sqe4C-4TXLiv9TPlExfHmg.text: Table Thai came highly recommended and I decided to check it out. The interior is nice thought not that big.  Service was excellent and friendly.  There is a vegan section in the menu but the restaurant serves meat/seafood as well. I really enjoyed the taste of the food, especially the freshness and flavors.  Pricing was moderate and portions fair. Solid restaurant overall.

H2jbGMQBMceDKra93tkaWA.text: I was recommended this place by a friend a couple of years ago and it is still one of my go to spots in Vegas! This is the Thai Tea and Thai Coffee! Perfect for this Vegas weather!  Their vegan and veggie options are very broad and extra tasty. I'm not Vegan but I sure ate their new Vegan chicken wings. I also had their Chocolate Cheesecake (also vegan)  Another thing I love about Table Thai is that it is in a perfect location in the middle of town so I can ALWAYS stop by to get my Thai fix between errands

AU2Ds0bm3_z_LTGPYqsGVQ.text: Good food and everyone is nice and welcoming! Environment is nice for date ! Best customer service !

6MFxn50qIdT-rBWzrGtZ_w.text: Very quaint restaurant, nice zen environment.  Service was good and friendly.   Our food did not take long.  We had the fried rice and Thai spice mixed meats, the vegetables were so fresh!   Lots of veggie options.

DVrpdRkyHA5k3wIMZmnbUA.text: My parents and I visited Table Thai yesterday and had an awesome experience! It is a smaller restaurant but very cute decor with comfy seats. Our server was very attentive and friendly.   We ordered the combo appetizer, pineapple shrimp curry, garlic green beans with chicken, crab fried rice, and the mango with sticky rice to finished. Plus, one Thai ice tea and Thai ice coffee. The combo appetizer is a good option for three people to share as it includes a little bit of everything.   My favorite among the plate was the egg roll and the coconut shrimp. The chicken satay came with a peanut sauce that I really enjoyed. The pineapple shrimp curry was amazing. The curry had so many layers of flavor and was mildly spicy. It was a thinner consistency, similar to a broth. It came with huge pieces of shrimp and loaded with pineapples and veggies. My favorite dish was the garlic green beans with chicken. It was savory but sweet and the fried garlic pieces added nice texture and fragrance to the dish. The chicken to green beans ratio was perfect and it came with a side of white rice which was much needed to soak up all that delicious sauce! The crab fried rice was another winner! There was huge chunks of crab meat in the rice along with some vegetables. It was definitely enough for 2-3 people to share as well! Portions here are definitely very reasonable for the price.   Last but not least, the mango with coconut sticky rice was the perfect dessert to top everything off! The mango was juicy and beautifully presented. The sticky rice wasn't too sweet but just enough to counteract the slight sourness in the mango. I definitely recommend ordering this desert when it is available.   Overall, we had an amazing experience. This place is about 15 mins from the strip but they do offer delivery as well!

q6zwulixEz2F2_vx365dGg.text: I had a late-night craving for Thai food and this was the only place open late enough to deliver. The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't my favorite either.  The Chicken Satay was pretty bland, and the peanut sauce wasn't as creamy as I normally see at other restaurants. It was very oily and the ingredients were separating in the container. I had to stir it up before every bite.  The Fresh Roll with Shrimp was very messy and hard to eat. It was falling apart more and more with every bite. The rice paper was ripping before I even picked it up.   The Beef Pho did not have the traditional thin Vermicelli noodles that I was expecting. Instead the noodles were wider and flatter, and the broth had a sweet taste to it.   Like I said, the food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't what I was expecting and didn't really satisfy my craving.

9WCiKIgeRizWvx0qMUOPCQ.text: It's nice to have some good quality Thai food on this side of town.  Food is fresh, well balanced and packed with flavor.  The Chef and his staff really have a passion for what they are creating as It shows in the plate presentation.   Best time to eat is anytime, how ever, slip in for dinner on Mondays or Tue for some special attention.

w7pQI7mP6I3xs6USpC7vDQ.text: The yellow chicken curry with veggies was out if this world...loved the soup and salad, and the rice was oust and delicious. Definitely coming back again!

i5uQurxoe7VPzsSW2bhTrA.text: Pad Thai & Drunken Noodle take out. Flavor so-so, but display and package superb. It's harder to find good service than good food. Will return to try again.

C-ZEYcLyYd9Y87GJVdIrRQ.text: First off - the service is exceptional. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Now on to the food - AMAZING!  The shu Mai appetizer was delicious. For entree we had the blue canvas curry and the spicy eggplant with shrimp. The curry was delightful - creamy and full of flavor. The eggplant picked up deliciousness of the home-made sauce and was really really tasty. They make all the sauces from scratch here so they all have a very unique flavor. I will definitely be back again.

mbh_wmVmQsvhytM8lKEgwQ.text: This place is great and I love the Vegan options. Ordered takeout several times and I am always satisfied.  Awesome location, very clean, super friendly...can't wait to dine in sometime.  Def a place to check out!!!!

EAFiHOBbj1JlESr10oGdQA.text: Decided to try it based on the high rating. Was NOT DISAPPOINTED,  great service , awesome food , and was very clean . I also liked the chill music , great atmosphere  for a date or family dinner.

VGhoZhZ9qh1ohKJQLLXNLA.text: This is one of our favorite places to eat when we're in the mood for Thai. The staff is always so friendly and always attentive. We start with the crispy veggie rolls--the best I've had. They're so crispy! And then we usually order the panang curry with chicken plus a veggie based dish. Haven't had a dish we didn't like yet. Definitely recommend this restaurant!

oefcAV4RqVymU2Uo18J9ug.text: Tried on grub hub for the first time. .my order was ready on time and was very very flavorful.   Great menu and selection ....will be back for sure

ss6mBKyWqbRUp7JIpo5MQg.text: We read YELP reviews and decided to stop by on one of the worst days of the year to eat out, Mother's Day,  Yelper's have not disappointed me this time and we will be eating at Table Thai from not on as a neighborhood restaurant.  Being from the San Francisco Bay Area, where ethnic food is the norm and coming from an extensive food background, we're discerning eaters.  This place has all the key things you need to be happy, eat well, not break the bank and enjoy a good time with your special someone or any friend.  Lipi gave us the friendly, royal treatment and a discount for me on Mother's Day.  We tried the Chef's recommendation for Thai sausage with varied accoutrements, which was some of the most delicious sausage (and I am not a sausage person).  The casing was so thin, the flavors meld.  Next came our small bowl of flavorful Tom Yum and you need to order it to taste it and enjoy the presentation.  For an entree we got the Lazy Duck, and honestly, the portion compared to other Thai places is generous and stunning.  From the minute we arrived, the ambiance, the warm friendly service was apparent.  We plan to go back, maybe, tonight and often.  I rarely post YELP reviews, but Thai Table and their staff, deserve a rave review...  Oh, sidenote, got the biggest Thai iced tea served in a huge mason jar mug and BF had our fav beer to pair with Thai food, Chang.

MBQmerd9Gvuri8ZVuBq2iQ.text: We went here with our kids. The dining area is small and quiet. The food was delicious. We had the Crying Tiger, Pan Nang, Chow Min, and fried rice. Everything was delicious and fresh tasting.

MWdETIJw0XQRDv_hiSGeCg.text: Amazing food & service! The crab fried rice & BBQ pork were my favorite! Chicken panang & pad thai also very good.

CTkVe3S0gVJrw8wbXrOpXQ.text: We came for lunch, the atmosphere was great and the service was also wonderful.  The food was really laking flavor, I got the chicken pad thai and my husband got the green curry salmon.  My pad thai needed salt and the salmon was definitely frozen fish.  We also ordered egg rolls which had great crunch but the inside was mush, no texture.  The service would bring me back but the food is forgettable.

Zi2xDidl312tCh72o1APrg.text: Excellent food and great prices. Tried the the pad Thai Thai one of my favorites. Seafood soup amazing flavor as well and the service has been great both times I was there. Can't remember her name but she treated us amazing and gave great suggestions. I will be back for sure!

GQhdiOrW8F1TD6MfDMQ25A.text: Oh my goodness gracious! Phenomenal! Absolutely the best thai I have ever tasted! I cannot talk more highly about this place! Do not give reviews often but when it is this good I must! Not one complaint- perfection- I suggest the pineapple curry duck and the lagoons also the spices are very authentic to levels of spiciness! My business partners and I go atleast one a week now and it's been great every time!

yKzaAbpZUhKHMSW6f0f5_Q.text: I always order delivery from this place and they always get my order right even with substitutions, the food here is sooo good and arrives in a timely manner!

nPg26lCkiZI7whzfHFBolA.text: This is a solid Thai restaurant located on the East side of the Valley. It's small but has a clean, upscale feel. Dimly lit, it's also quiet, making it a nice place to enjoy a low key meal. I took my lunch club there and everyone raved about the food. I had the lunch special with a drink and my tab was under $11 without a tip. Wow. Hard to find a good lunch for that price. The waiters were prompt and gracious. We even asked for separate checks and they were fine with that.  I was a little upset because two of my group did not show up but the waitress took care of removing a table so it worked. I will go again and take my husband next time.

jnrZeMEJcK9na8BmuSaJuQ.text: The food was perfect...Sea food curry and Pad see ewe were some of the best I have ever had. THE banana pie for dessert was so good,it just wasn't enough...
