ooPYq5K_RYyBrMjWKZmPGA.text: I stop by today for lunch their menu is an interesting offered between 11-3pm and the prices are under$10 for the 18 different lunch listed.serve with viggie or egg drop soup rice and salad and having vegan option!!! Service was great everyone was really friendly and welcome and helpful they explained to me very clearly.i had E-San set it's was awesome the set come with BBQ chicken Salad Sticky rice and papaya salad I'm very happy eating ;)..I will definetely recommend this restaurant

epYBSmkaJX3WwgfIIEXkDA.text: I like trying new places to eat and thought from the reviews that this place would be good. How wrong I was. I usually give people the benefit of the doubt, but I will not be giving this place another chance. The food, at best, was mediocre. Maybe I didn't get their specialties. But that wasn't the main issue. I made my order for delivery around 6:00 PM last night. An hour later the delivery lady calls and says she can't find our location. I couldn't understand her because her accent was so bad.  My daughter had to talk to her and finally got her pointed in the right direction. Well over an hour has now passed and she finally gets here with the food. No apologie, the food is cold and she has the gall to blame us for not giving her the right address. What is Google maps for? Needless to say I won't be eating here ever again.

e6B3FBDGXdcVKILXn4XXpg.text: This place is a gem! While visiting my old stomping grounds in Vegas, I met up with some friends for dinner here one night. It was my first time here, but I'd heard great things. Table Thai did not disappoint! The decor and ambience was nice, the food was delicious, and their Thai tea was yummy and generously sized. What more could you ask for? If I still lived in Vegas I'd be here every other day.

fxcTUDHKxVcRpbCW3-5Qmw.text: Some of the best Thai I've had in Vegas!!!  I've traveled to Thailand for the last 20 years and this place gets as close to "home" Thai cooking than I've ever had in this town.  The service was top shelf; the prices are spot on; and the food was amazing!  I had the Tom Kha soup and the Panang Curry and both tasted like I was on the streets of Bangkok.  If you like Thai food--THIS is the place for you; and if you haven't tried something new--THIS is the place for you as well.    I'll be back again and again and again!

ovHNAxcQaIEplZxk0OB-og.text: This place has amazing food and amazing staff. they are really sweet and care about their food and customer service. The restaurant itself is nice and relaxing and the food was better than I expected it to be. One of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas for me, I've been looking forever for good Thai food In Vegas and finally found it. Happy I gave this place a try.

NZ8RsJDA1JH94Io55cMnBQ.text: Offers a vegetarian menu, be carful ai found they use a fish sauce in some lunch items that are supposed to be vegetarian.  Found a piece of chicken in the "vegan" soup- not a good thing.   Changing my review because of this.

KZDT9XhspNoUj_xRZ8zl7g.text: First time here and I was really impressed! Lipi and Patty waited on us and they were both an absolute pleasure. They helped us choose an appetizer and an entree. The food was very delicious and not too heavy. I've never had such personal service. I will definitely be back!!

ZIQM5V_RnSNVZt1GtrFcMg.text: Love the crab fried rice. A little pricey however, the food is very good. Watch out for the level 5 spice it's hottt!!!

Cdujp9XjpQLmP14NZyc4eg.text: Go for a terrific weekday lunch- affordable, delicious, and thoughtfully presented. The restaurant is a small space, but there's never a wait or line, and the friendly staff is attentive.

9Byt_WNfVIZf-87xtit1sA.text: We had the spicy basil and the garlic and pepper, both were excellent. The service here is awesome and prices are very reasonable. Highly recommend this Thai restaurant.

qAFIwK_d4FhvJ1F3CzHJ1g.text: Fantastic. I had their salmon with mango. Delicious m their soup was also  great. I could taste all of the ingredients in there, especially the green peas. Service was great and the place is clean and well decorated. 5 stars.

gN8SXV0OWkvB217N5CSKAA.text: Such a great spot! Nice, dark atmosphere and wonderful service. Try the spicy seafood soup!

5z9micqOIuZiqea1GrQFnQ.text: We love this place! So excited they have a vegan menu. The vegan curry is amazing!  Nice atmosphere and great customer service :)

7tkcMVz9Lw9qtyI87ZadEg.text: I have ordered  from Table Thai approximately 4 times,  never had an issue. Today I ordered something from their menu that was supposed to be meatless. Once the order was delivered I opened it up and found it drowning in chicken. I called table thai back and told them my order was incorrect. They told me that because I didn't say no meat, even though it says there's no meat, they add whatever they think for meat and it was my fault for not saying no meat....the description clearly read no meat! Noodle, tomatoes, basil, and spicy garlic sauce! After arguing with them for almost 10 minutes they finally said they would send another order. About 10 minutes went by and they called me back telling me that my order was on the way and they want the other order back! Can you belive that? Who does that?! What are they going to do resell it? I have the order still obviously but really!! Who asks for a order that was made wrong back?...I will never order from them again.

6nJWWdjMpQPmVWvQK1mPIA.text: We ordered four items off of their vegan menu and all four were phenomenal! The orange tofu was by far the fave, but the four seasons, spicy tofu and veggie tempura were all top notch too. Plus the staff was so kind and so friendly with our children. We will definitely be back for more!!! Everyone should eat here!

Cmw_SsHFMD7ZES0QBMBHVA.text: If I could give this restaurant 10 Stars, I would do so. The food is scrumptious. We have dined there over twenty times, and it is excellent each time, no matter what we order. The portions are quite generous too. The decorations and atmosphere are lovely, and it is immaculate. The service is exceptional. The women are friendly, attentive, and professional - A+ one and all. I highly recommend this restaurant and have recommended it to dozens of people I know. If you want to treat yourself, try this gem. Madelyn M

BHlucsCqYa4TLrhM1yii5w.text: Came here for a big group lunch and thankfully we had a reservation--the place was packed and even parking was right! Very clean, modern looking restaurant. I ordered a small Tom Kha chicken soup which was delicious and HUGE! Prices were definitely reasonable, too. The small cup of soup was $5. The server was concerned that it might not be enough food but their serving sizes for everything are massive. Great service, will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6s4LEin7JUZIOkAwEzjDWw.text: I do not live in Las Vegas, but while here, visited this place 3 times. It's one of those places where you say, "Damn, I wish I had something like this where I live." Excellent quality, ambiance, price, and service.  I find most Thai restaurants to be just that - Thai restaurants. If you want Thai food, you go there. So, you'll accept mediocrity. This is NOT one of those places.   Had so many things off the menu, and everything was excellent. Please support Table Thai. They're awesome.

e3mNxfqgPg4PPxTSbJ78AQ.text: Good service, great food, large portions! I would definitely come back again. For dinner time on a Thursday, there was no wait. The employees are very attentive to the customers.

Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodle with beef

LVnQRIndeahe_n4QpZvRWg.text: This place is f-ing amazing. The food made me so happy and gave me such a high that I know I will never forget about this experience. I can't wait till i go back. I know there is a God, because only a deity could create something as delicious and intoxicating as this food. I will be going to church tomorrow to thank Jesus almighty for Thai food from Table Thai to pray that I will eat more in the future of my life. God bless.

Y-Z3WUNuX20yq1lf_Ucl9A.text: I'm on a mission to find the best affordable Thai food in Vegas. Although, Thai food never is that expensive in general.   I used to live in SF so Thai food used to be a staple for me, but sometimes it's hard to find a really good place in Vegas.  I would definitely recommend table Thai. The ambiance is nice, it's kind of dark. I got the pad se ew with beef. It was really flavorful, but I found that they added a little too much beef. It was kind of hard for me to eat, a little to chewy. I ended up moving all the beef to the side of my plate, which was 1/3 of the food and just ate the noodles and vegetables in it.   The staff was very friendly. They kept asking us how we liked the food and were very attentive.  I definitely want to come back and try the curry next time!

_vMpjBD4YzGiT_PGUd7FOg.text: So far so good. The dining area is really nice. The menu is pretty extensive and they have different duck dishes that sets this place apart from other Thai places in the area.   Since I was at the coffee shop for a couple hours and it was already lunch time when we left there, decided to stop by and check out this place for their lunch specials.  Lunch plates are offered between 11-4pm and the prices are under $10 for the 18 different entrees listed. Comes with a clear broth soup with a dash of black pepper seasoning. Also choice of steam or brown rice. Nice that they don't up charge you for brown rice!  They had great entree choices but I chose my standby dish; Yellow Curry Tofu to see how it measures up to the other Thai places. Unfortunately it was just okay for me. I was a little bummed out. Oh well.  The seasonings were not present and the curry was weak IMO .  The rice though that accompanied my order was cooked perfectly and I ate that all.  And I normally don't finish my rice!  I am impressed that the lunch portions offered are a pretty good size for lunch meals.  More food than lunch plates offered in other places.  The menu is an interesting read. Thirsty Drink,(for drinks) Sweet Lover(aka desserts), Hot & Warm,( Spicy and Mild I think they meant)  but what's Health & Healthy? I do appreciate the menu is organized into sections which made it easy to read and quick enough to zero in to what you are hungry for.  Even though my order was messed up initially, service here is great! The staff is really nice and my orders came out pretty quickly. I DO look forward to coming back here again. When I have a bigger appetite I want to try out  one one of the duck dishes and some of the Chef Recommendations for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Table Thai Bar & Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch size portion of Yellow Curry

q7w17yhd4Pb-kK94DlYwEg.text: The delivery person was very sweet and friendly. He was probably the better part of our dinner experience. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't special by any stretch of the imagination and for what we paid, that is a disappointment. It was about the same quality and freshness as one of the dozen Thai lunch specials around town for $8 except some of the dishes cost $15+! At these prices we were expecting really tasty, amazing Thai dishes and that just wasn't the case. We ordered a range of items including Yellow Curry, Pad Thai Thai (which was overly sweet), Fried rice, Spicy Basil Noodles, Curry puffs (as appetizer came with 5 pieces...which were very bland for a whopping $9!), and teriyaki chicken. All tasted just fine (except the curry puffs) but were simply overpriced for what we got. For this quality, I will definitely go to a cheaper place next time.

NKjLTnamiPolsg-im9WABA.text: Yet another case of inflated yelp ratings IMHO. I got pad Thai to go with tofu for the lunch special. They initially got my order incorrect but they were quick to fix it and the customer service was great. The spring roll that came with the meal was pretty good, the salad was okay but was drenched with dressing, and I liked how everything was packaged. However, the pad Thai was pretty bad. The entire noodle dish was a strange reddish color (although I got it spicy, it was usual) and I was also wondering why I got a lemon instead of lime with it??? I was really hoping that I'd be able to find good Thai food on this side of town but it looks like the search will continue.   I would however, give them 5 stars for the service. Everyone I interacted with was very friendly, nice, and quick.  Edit- got food poisoning over this. Not pretty.

OY4ajWJWlXpHL0dYyjzfYA.text: A solid lunch option nearby the office. Friendly service and food is served rather quickly. Their complimentary soup is refreshing and a great starter to the entree.

FIsISJ5ZyTcZwo550ffekQ.text: Whenever I walk toward the entryway of Sunrise Coffee I have a tendency of looking up at the low flying airplanes ready for landing at McCarren International Airport. A couple of weeks ago, for a change I decided to look down where I set eyes on the Table Thai lunch menu. Where the adventurers in the airplanes were about to land this adventurer was about to take off on a flight that carried me to an interesting dining adventure. My dining adventures at Table Thai would be my first. This marks the first time that I have dined in a Thai restaurant solo. This review reflects on my two food adventures in Table Thai this past week.    Both times that I ate here, it was off the lunch menu. Everyday, Table Thai serves a lunch special from 11 AM to 3 PM. The prices range from $7 to $13. The majority of the lunch specials include mixed salad, rice, and wonton soup with a glass of water with ice. I'd order the barbecue chicken on the leading visit then pad thai on the second. Further into this review, I will talk about them in further detail.     Upon walking inside, I was surprised to be surrounded by an upscale interior. I expected a take out environment. A friendly lady, I believe is one an owner, walked me to a table by the open kitchen. We walked on a new brown floor that the lady would joke with a customer that you can dance on it. Forget about wanting to dance, it would be hard to want to leave the comfortable booth seat. First off, the waitress put the glass of water and ice on the table. I ordered a Coke ahead of the meal. The waitress opened a can of Coke that she poured in a glass of ice. I failed to see hot tea on the menu. After she poured the Coke, I ordered the barbecue chicken. There was around a 15 minute delay before the freshly made lunch arrived. I entertained myself with the Internet compliments of the complimentary Sunrise Coffee WiFi next store.       The barbecue chicken lunch plate was 1/4 entree, 1/4 rice, and it seemed 1/2 mixed salad. The barbecue chicken was quality over quantity. I enjoyed every bite to the bone. This chicken would leave a nice aftertaste that is a sign of using quality ingredients. The rice was allright. The brown rice I ordered looked more like white rice. And tasted like white rice. The wonton soup came at the same time as the meal. It featured one wonton, broccoli, and peas. After lunch, I decided to return to try pad thai.      My second visit was a more adventurous lunch. This was the first time that I dined in a Thai restaurant by myself. This is the first time I partook in a meal with only water. And it was one of my leading times eating pad thai. This was more of a genuine Thai restaurant experience than the last. What is a good Thai restaurant experience? According to McDang a well known expert on Thai cuisine, the food must have intricacy; attention to detail; texture; color; taste; good flavor; and the use of ingredients with medicinal benefits. My pad thai met McDang's expectations with the exception of ingredients with medicinal benefits. The pad thai lunch was $7 and included wonton soup, mixed salad, and water. The pad thai occupied 70% of the plate. My protein was chicken. I told the waitress to make this stir-fried rice noodle dish with a 4 out of 5 spiciness. The pad thai was outstanding. I did not feel the 4 out of 5 spicy. Maybe I have a tolerance to spicy food. Regardless I know great food when I taste it.     Based on the two visits, just like the barbecue chicken the experience left me with a nice aftertaste. That means that I might be back. If I return here, I would order the pad thai over the barbecue. It appears that pad thai is one of Table Thai's signature dishes. Then again I might further extend my horizons and try something totally different.

h7xBjOHHWOfJ9JVmGLjRIQ.text: I wanted a quiet meal after a LONG day at work on my feet, and I had a craving for Thai. My usual Thai place in Las Vegas is always super busy and bustling, so I decided to try something new. Table Thai is located a bit off the beaten path, and the area around it seems mostly commercial, so they were pretty quiet for dinner. Just what I wanted!   I was absolutely STARVING, so I ordered pad see ew, extra broccoli, with both chicken and tofu. The portion sizes are huge. Everything was prepared just the way I like it. Crisp veggies, not overcooked. Just the right amount of spice. The tofu was crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. Good flavor. Tons of noodles. Not too greasy. I tried my best to finish it because it was so good, but I didn't quite manage.   The waitress was sweet, helpful, and attentive without being overbearing. Bathrooms clean. Parking easy. Modern decor. Definitely worth checking out.   I will have to go back just to try out the dessert menu.

U57MXR61BV1F2rtJcvxGKw.text: After reading some good reviews and being recommended by a close friend, I decided to give Table Thai Bar & Bistro a try. I visited in a Sunday afternoon and the restaurant only serves dinner. The parking lot locates in front of the restaurant so just a few walks to the door. The front door is neat and clean with clear business hour on. Exotic decorations such as elephants which are the symbols of Thailand, Thai ladies wearing traditional dresses and some paintings show the culture and landscape of Thailand. The dining room was almost full by the time I arrived, I was surprised that most of the guests were with their families so I would say this is a kids-friendly restaurant or a perfect place to have family gatherings. There is not a full bar in the restaurant since the size of the restaurant is rather small but I noticed there is a long rectangular table in the middle can seat proximately 8-10 guests.   The restaurant only equipped with 2 servers that day so after it opened, guests arrived quite at the same time so we waited a good 10 minutes to get someone to order the food. I order the Lamb Panang curry because it's rare to see Thai restaurant serves lamb rack or lamb chop in curry sauce, compared to Indian cuisine. The presentation was excellent with a pinch of thai spice on the edge, and some lightly fried mint leaves underneath. I smelt coconut milk in the curry and the distinctively gamy smell of lamb. The spicy taste was on point and met my expectation with a slightly salty finish. My taste buds were covered by the pungent curry flavor and a naturally sweet coconut milk came afterwards. The lamb was cooked perfectly medium rare with tender and juicy pink center. A little bit crispy at the edge and the small amount of lamb fat added the unique texture to the dish. Plain asparaguses were not seasoned or added flavors so they can balance the strong flavor created by the curry and lamb. Asparagus itself is crunchy, fresh and sweet, it helped me to cleanse the palate and get rid of the excessive spicy taste. Overall I enjoyed the food that I ordered. This is a restaurant well worth to try and return.

OznqMk_i1etb-LrVuh8zBQ.text: Went there alone tonight around 10pm. It was nice that they were open late. I ordered the Panang curry with chicken, spicy #4 (out of 5) and a coke. They have coke in cans, and it bothers me paying $2+ for a can of coke, and the water came warm from the tap with a few ice cubes and a sliver of lemon. The place and food presentation are nice, and most of the servers are nice, but I won't be dining there again. My food was not spicy at all. I had them bring out the little pots caddy thing with the spicy stuff and it mildly helped. When I told the server I did not wish for a box, she grilled me about why not. I plain out told her that it wasn't tasty or spicy. She said,"oh, ok. Next time, save room for dessert." Wow.

anXgVskJASNl286ov5bQYg.text: I ordered pickup , pad see ew was great , the Thai was very flavorful , they move at a very efficient way and the food taste great ! Next time I'll dine in , looks very comfortable inside and the food is great !

qKsgoMCShspkvjDw0Yu5AA.text: The hours at this location are the most convenient for my schedule, so they're one of my favorite places to eat, but that's not the only reason for this review. They are very accommodating to vegan diets and can make most of the curries and soups vegan upon request. Their separate vegan menu is also legit, but I usually tend to go towards the Massaman or Panang curry with soy beef (vegan). Also, their lunch specials every week day has been an ultimate life saver for time and money.

wc8D5Cm43X-dSKkFpcYDTw.text: After two visits to Table Thai and a couple of lunch deliveries to my office, I feel comfortable saying that it's one of my favorite Thai places in the valley.  Table Thai is located on Sunset between Pecos & Eastern, a couple doors down from Sunrise Coffee.  The interior is surprisingly warm and welcoming for a strip mall spot.  It's not large, about 10-12 tables that get packed during lunchtime.  Some of the tables have plush chairs and benches, some have wooden-like chairs; all are comfortable.  There are also a couple of large TV's mounted on the wall if you want to watch while dining.  Our service has been exceptional thus far. Everyone here is friendly and accommodating.  Our server was refilling our water glasses before they were even half empty, courses came out quickly, and everything was hot and fresh.  My most recent visit: Tom Kha Soup with Shrimp ($12) 5/5 The broth is so complex and delicious that we kept taking 'just one more spoonful' even though we were full.    Green Papaya Salad ($9) 4/5 So fresh and vibrant.  Delicious and a nice palate cleanser.  Spicy Basil with Shrimp ($14) 5/5 I love that their Spicy Basil is comprised of large pieces of vegetables and protein instead of ground up like a lot of Thai restaurants.  I think their 3 out of 5 heat rating was a little too spicy for me (I might be a wimp).  I got a 2 out of 5 when I had it delivered and that was just fine for me!  Pad Thai with Shrimp ($10) 3/5 Tasty, but nothing special.  There are far better choices at Table Thai in my opinion.  Spicy Eggplant with Tofu ($11) 4/5 Very similar to the Spicy Basil with the addition of eggplant.  This one was ordered at a 4 out of 5 heat rating, so I only sampled a piece of eggplant and a couple peppers because it was hot!  But what I did have was very good.  Thai Tea Crepe Cake ($7) I don't want to rate this one because the consistency was gross to me, but the Thai Tea drizzle was delicious.  Everyone else in my group of 5 loved it.

IQbTodxTcErOmKBFdRMS5w.text: 4.5 stars is my rating because this was the best Pad See Ew I've had in Vegas! Dropped in on a Saturday night around 7pm. Wasn't too busy, they have about 12 tables inside a beautifully decorated small restaurant. Nice soft chairs to sit in. They do serve alcohol now, I saw several asian beers available and some sake as well.   Service was excellent. I believe the owner seated me and took my order. Very nice lady. The food was excellent as well, I ordered my standard crab rangoon appetizer, and Pork Pad See Ew. The crab rangoon had a really good orange citrus sauce that looked homemade and not from a jar. Excellent taste!  The pork pad see ew was also delicious, cooked well and the stir fry sauce wasn't too sweet as I've had other places. Complimented the flavors of the pork, noodles, and egg instead of overpowering it. Like I said, it was the best I've had in Vegas and I've eaten at a lot of Thai places.  I'll be back again and again because the food really is good, the menu is fairly extensive with many options including some Japanese and Chinese options.

r-CGF9-BEy6o5dtB2sYvnA.text: Solid vegan section-thankful for so many good options. Had tapas style/light-dinner which included curry puffs, sticky mango rice, coconut shrimp, and tiramisu crepe cake (made in house.) Great food and great service

f7nYZ4egTOVLkDsz4ykMBA.text: We love coming here for the lunch special which comes with the entree, salad and soup, and I believe a soft drink. I get their really sweet and delicious Thai tea, so what does the soft drink even matter? We like the dinner specials as well which are reasonably priced.   My favorite go-to item is the yellow curry, which no matter how much I try to order something else I can't help it. My husband has ordered the pad Thai and it's also delicious.   Service is good and it's never too busy to sit down and eat, their presentation for take out and delivery is also excellent.

88KJNf-mbrJ2I-0mq_p62Q.text: My go-to Thai spot for sure. Conveniently located at the same plaza as Sunrise Coffee , right across Sunset Park.  Dark, dim interior - and open late. Prices for entrees/main courses are pricier than other Thai eateries , but I liked the ambiance and the way they cook the food here - so I didn't mind !  Food-wise , try the Crying Tiger or the Thai chicken bbq - my old-time favorite here is always the pad see ew. Their spice level is from 1 - 5. They have various hot sauces and peppers as well to give your meal that extra kick ! You have to ask for them though since they keep it in the back. They also have excellent dessert. They're the only place I know who serve Thai tea crepe cake , my favorite.  They have a menu for lunch specials from 11 am - 3 pm , cheaper and same portion amount.  Service is always great , the waitress was very kind and always checked on us to make sure we have enough water , (since we were probably sweating our eyes out). One night I was waiting for a to-go order , and one of the ladies gave me a free Thai iced tea while I waited which was very sweet of her :)

65j3JRerfeKBeq9F5pF6Xw.text: For the past two years, this has been my and my husband's go to place. We loved it. We drove across town just to eat here. We came for every celebration and special event. I told everyone I knew to come here. But not any more.  I don't know if it is new management or a new chef, but the food and the service have taken a serious dive. We noticed the change in November and waited until tonight to try again, just in case it was one off night. Nope.  We always ordered the same things: pad see eiw, panang curry, and pineapple fried rice. It used to be the best in town. But now, the panang curry is way too thick and the flavor is off. It used to be so creamy with the perfect balance of seasonings and coconut milk. I can hardly stomach it any more, and the chicken is far different from the thin and juicy slices they used to have. The pad see eiw has come out cold both times with too little sauce and tough beef I can hardly chew. The pineapple fried rice had chunks of balled up rice and no flavor. The spice it totally unpredictable. Consistency is key with any food but mostly when it comes to spice level. You never know what you're going to get.  There used to be one girl working here that was phenomenal. I don't know if she is still with the place, but I haven't seen her. She used to be there every time we came in. It probably would have been better with her here. The new staff is short and seems to try to ignore you. Maybe I'm just holding them to the unfair standard the other girl set...she was really fantastic.  To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I will miss what this place used to be.

TQEEQKth7F4050jROh8oaA.text: By far. The best Thai restaurant I've been to/eaten at/had food delivered from. The staff is amazing and friendly! Some of the best curry I've ever had has been here. Green, red, and panang have been the ones i've tried and have enjoyed tremendously. Asking for extra veggies has been my favorite additional item for these particular dishes. My friend and I love this little gem. They have varieties of milk to accommodate those with restrictions or preferences. I specially love having my thai tea with coconut milk! Yummy. There has not been an item I have not liked so far. Centrally located as far as the city limits are concerned and even if it is not for you, the rewards for dining or ordering from here will absolutely make it worth it. Thank you TTBB! You guys rock!

3Xn8CwvXJ39IS3LO7jniyA.text: The BEST Thai food in the city, hands down.   This place is a little hidden, tucked inside a shopping center right next to Sunrise Coffee. The inside is very nicely decorated, with some of the most comfortable couches/chairs I have ever sat on in a restaurant. The restaurant has a level of elegance that makes you feel like you're eating at a fancy restaurant without being overwhelmingly stuffy or overpriced.   The staff were INCREDIBLY friendly and attentive. My water glass was never even half empty. And they were more than ready to offer suggestions when we were struggling to pick what we wanted to eat because everything on the menu sounded so good.  We ended up ordering the Season Rolls, Tom Kha Soup, Drunken Noodles with Chicken and Massaman Curry. First, let me say how happy I am that a place is finally combining egg/spring rolls with summer rolls on one appetizer. I always want to eat both, and usually have to pick, but the combination is a great idea, and I wish more restaurants did this. The soup was delicious, and a HUGE portion. Not only does your bowl get filled, but the container with extra broth on the side means you get the equivalents of two bowls of soup. The noodles weren't bad, a little too heavy on the onions, but otherwise no complaints. The curry was definitely the star. Awesome blend of spices.   I'd strongly recommend this place, even if you don't live on this side of town, it is worth the drive.

EDTAsOHncr33A0uMhMwkQw.text: I was craving Thai food one day and since my go-to place was temporarily closed, I decided to try this place out.  Location: Table Thai is located next to Sunrise Coffee. The interior is very intimate and elegant, with no more than 20 tables throughout the entire restaurant. It is dimly lit and very quiet, perfect to take someone out on a date.  Food:  Thai Tea (4/5): Decent Thai tea, but not the best I've ever had. I'm not sure if it was just my drink, but it tasted a bit watered down.  Jade Curry (3/5): I had ordered the Jade curry with tofu and spicy level 7. I honestly was not impressed. You can order this with either brown or white rice. Though the portions were big, I could not help but notice how watered down and oily-looking it was. After wanting Thai curry for so long, I was left disappointed in my dish. Be careful about spice levels if you do not eat spicy food often. I would recommend no more than a level 5 if you are not used to spice!  Service: Staff was friendly, accommodating, and attentive. Our server was very knowledgeable on the menu and was able to ask all our questions.  With the abundance of Thai restaurants popping up all over the Valley, Table Thai ranks average. I would come back if I was around the area, but next time I crave Thai food I will probably end up giving another establishment a try.

Xm8N-AJNs2YBbzD75NiUHg.text: We had such a great meal here. We genuinely enjoyed the ambiance, the service and the food. I'm so glad I found this spot. My favorite thing on the menu was the Tom Kha Soup. Oh my goodness!!! It was soooo good that I am craving it right now and it's only been a day since we last ate here. Our server was very funny and kind. Anna definitely makes me want to come back.

SwEXFf-4J82OE2XIEFnOeQ.text: Very tasty food, awesome service, great atmosphere. Glad we came here for the dinner!

-kwAv8XWRMQzUEb4YG9NOg.text: Thai is always great for lunch because of the lunch specials. With that said, this place gets busy with the work lunch crowd. Price point is pretty good at under $10 with common dishes like pad thai and yellow curry ranging from $7-8.   I can't remember the last time I had pad thai, but I have been craving it for awhile. I'm glad I was able to try this place because their pad thai is really flavorful! Is there still a lime shortage? They serve this dish with lemon instead.  The sides that come with the lunch special are salad and won ton soup, which were average.   I sampled the yellow curry, which I was not all that impressed with. It was watered down and oily. Less flavorful than other Thai joints.   Another disappointment was the thai tea crepe cake, which tasted nothing like thai tea. The color was the only thing that looked like thai tea. The texture was nice and overall a very light and not too sweet of a dessert.   The interior is clean and modern with lots of natural light. Our server made us feel rushed, like trying to clear plates before we were done kind of thing. Otherwise, not too bad. Food came out quick and our waters were never empty.   *****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge***** 46/100

They even remember all the things we like. We have been going for a few years, and will continue. This is such a local gem!

UGuzYrlFlL9vyuBDuw1NLg.text: Absolutely love this place! Thankful that I live so close so it's an easy pick up or dine in. Staff is always kind and helpful. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because their spice level is not as consistent as I would like it to be. One day a 3 is perfect and the next week a 3 is too hot for us (we still eat it though, food is amazing). Highly recommend the Tom Kha, Pineapple Fried Rice and Jade Curry. Plenty of vegan options as well!

TJF__lVILDmqRpcBHEaCvQ.text: This might be my go-to place for food delivery while in Vegas. Best yellow curry I've ever had, and that's saying something considering my family use to own a Thai restaurant. I'm very picky with my Thai.   Although they impressed me thoroughly with the yellow curry & basil fried rice, I was less than pleased with the drunken noodles and tom yum soup. You'd think with this 50/50 satisfaction rate, that I should give them 3/5 stars instead of 4/5 stars... but no, their yellow curry is that good. I highly recommend it.   Anyway with yelp eat24, they'll deliver to your hotel. It's cheaper than eating somewhere on the strip. Vegas is so expensive overall these days; smh.

ebj0Qth2qf-3NBIHuaC58Q.text: Food was Mediocre compared to other Thai Restaurants. The server was very polite and sweet, but a bit slow even with two customers at the place. Their bathroom was what impressed me the most. The vegetable eggroll was trash and satay chicken was dry. Coconut shrimp was bomb! The yellow curry which seems to be the rave was too sweet with undercooked carrots and potatoes. They offered to cook it a little longer, but I just wanted to get up outta there.

WCzk5q8JtrzseCfcT8kQ1A.text: This is basically a 3.5 star experience; I'll round down instead of up because I think they are a little overrated on Yelp atm.  I had the lunch with the salmon jade curry, which is basically a yellow curry with salmon in it. The dish came with a soup of some fairly uninspired veggies (pretty sure they came out of a frozen package). The main entree was solid, if overall unspectacular. Spice level was about right. The amount of salmon in the dish is not stingy, though I do think it is farm raised salmon. There were also some veggies in the dish. Overall I think it might have been a little overpriced but not too much. Not the best Thai food in town, not the worst. I would return, but I don't think I'd seek it out.

EbbtZ0SicJYd3dZTN4G1OQ.text: Amazing food & excellent service! I ordered to go & decided to eat it there after they gave me my food. They were very quick to clean a table for me & made me feel at home. I will definitely be hosting an even here or catering. Thank you Anna for your amazing service! You guys are officially my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas! Will definitely be referring friends & family!

dGwz1PE-bC4z9HnZowbB2Q.text: Although the service was pretty good I think the food was not  I ordered the beef pad su ew (sorry if it's miss spelled)and the chicken lap. The presentation was nice the both dishes was way too sweet!! Noodles were and the beef tasted like it was cooked in brown sugar. I have to say that I will not be going back

jjRLQ4iRgvfiyJtq1yOp3A.text: I would definitely come here if you like Thai food. Not a total authentic place but at the same time has a modern twist to it. Garlic & Pepper Chicken Vegetables with chicken *Heat 1-5*  Overall, the whole place is nice and clean. The place wasn't too small but big enough for a table of six. Definitely would come back or do takeout.

NfteFIuaOer9fOVSiKw8Fw.text: Heard about this and decided to stop by. Food was really good and the staff really friendly. Ordered Pad Thai, Kung Pao Chicken and Panang Curry. Everything we ordered was delicious!

37BjX9NYz6SReQ1w0mb2EA.text: Let's get one thing straight: Nobody likes those little crispy white pubic noodles on their food. Even our spunky waitress, expressed her disdain for them. She said they get stuck on her forehead sometimes. But that's neither here nor there. Let's get down to the review. Late night Table Thai and Bistro filled my tummy with happiness and warm, authentic Thai cuisine. After watching Muslims shoot Christians with machine guns at the local theater, Randall and I had worked up quite an appetite. All of the standard favs were closed, so we rolled the dice on this gem. Upon arriving, we noticed the small sign in the window that read "vegans welcome". This was almost as refreshing as the young coconut we ordered. We also had the soy orange chicken which was FIRE. I only wish they were open 24 hours so I could sleep here.

7_NfVSKniVviXxVELNbK2g.text: This is a happening little restaurant. Modern and very cool dinning room. Vegan menu is a little small but grateful that they do have one. little pricy but not over the top. Food was very flavorful and service was on point. The sever had a huge section but she managed it very gracefully and my water was never empty. I would come here for an occasion or a date night rather than just grabbing a bite to eat.

sqfUkY0t608k0zYQ3gHwIA.text: One of the best Thai places in town.. And there are a lot to choose from. Always fresh tasting ingredients and friendly service in a relaxed environment.. Lol this review sounds fake but It's not! Great place!

LjAIZUCYH8BDN90LxXuoWw.text: This is restaurant is starting to grow on me. There are so many Thai choices in Vegas and this is becoming my favorite go to place for Thai food.   Food: chicken Satay meat super tender and grilled to perfection. Tom Yum soup just the right amount of spice and flavor. Yellow curry my favorite curry goes so well with my rice it is addicting and finally the spicy basil ground chicken is the best around and I ate at many many Thai around town  Service: I was greeted warmly and treated very well. Can't ask anything more from the servers. Top notch  Great place great food. Warm people

YP5HzrTUKhmLjEh_MjkFGQ.text: Shortly after moving to Vegas, I had a great dining experience when this space was Taiga- I was distraught when they closed. Luckily, Table Thai is the same great service, tasty food, and elegant decor. Either they're still affiliated with the same owners, or this location is just lucky.   The DUCK ROLLS are a simple but tasty app, much preferred over the GREEN PAPAYA SALAD- menu said this came with shrimp, but the $9 price tag yielded only two, and I found the dish rather lackluster. Opted for the SPICY BASIL FRIED RICE with chicken, per other rave reviews and liked it- a 3 will get you good heat, and this contains an ample portion of protein. But the MANGO STICKY RICE was a winner for both flavor and presentation, featuring toasted sesame seeds that added a whole 'nother dimension to this classic dessert.  Service was ridiculously attentive, in the best possible way. Menu has well-priced lunch specials for those who work in the area, but the dinner specials make them stand out from other Thai options in the area. Props for offering lots of vegetarian and vegan dishes!

o-_xddQp6nxSBNa67uMlFw.text: I'm proud to add my voice to the chorus of love for this place.  We stumbled on Table Thai Bar & Bistro (TTBB) on a delivery site I will not name because they serviced our neighborhood. I hadn't realized I had had visited and thoroughly enjoyed TTBB before. I've stumbled on this place two times now and been pleased both time.  Everything we ordered was delicious. While there is a great deal of Thai food in Vegas, what I haven't seen much, is a eye toward vegan options. That's why we chose TTBB and that is why we will continue to come back. They dedicate a sizable portion of their menu to vegan fare--but it gets even better. From what I saw, many of the noodle dishes can include "soy chicken", "soy beef", or tofu. For those of us looking to reduce/eliminate animal protein in our diets, having proteins that extend beyond tofu is exciting.  And yes, I know that soy options may not be "healthy", but they provide plant-based eaters options when dining out.  We ate the gyoza, fresh rolls, pad see eiw, pad thai, and yellow curry. While I didn't love the texture of the noodles in the pad see eiw, I know that the noodles did not get a fair chance to impress us after traveling across town in a delivery car. The large chunks of carrot inthe curry were a little daunting, but after tasting the flavor of the curry I let my concerns go.   This is a place to add to your regular rotation--I know I've added it to mine.

7yYEb92DT_Fdmm0ClkuMpA.text: This is a solid Thai restaurant located next door to Sunrise Coffee. It's small but has a clean, upscale feel. Dimly lit, it's also quiet, making it a nice place to enjoy a low key meal as my family did on a Saturday night.  We were seated immediately at a table by the door when we arrived and were given excellent service by our server for our entire meal. Contrary to many other Thai places, our server was very amiable and gave us good recommendations even assisting us with the right spice level for our food. I'm not afraid of heat and can handle just about anything. But when I ordered 3 out of 5 spice level for our food, she immediately put me in check and said I should order 2 out of 5. I'm glad I did because the spice level was just right for everyone. All of her other recommendations were solid including: recommending the barbecue chicken when they were out of the teriyaki chicken for my daughter and her friend, dark meat instead of white for our curry, and not letting us pass up on dessert.  The menu consists of your usual Thai dishes with a bonus vegan section and chef recommendation section. Our usual shrimp rolls ($8), tom yum with shrimp ($12), and yellow curry with chicken ($11) were all up to par with the curry having a more depth of flavor with other spices compared to other places.   My daughter and her friend polished off the barbecue chicken ($10) and they gave us plenty of white rice as we needed it through our meal. I had the panang soft shell crab ($19) which the crab was fried perfectly and accompanied by some crisp asparagus and panang sauce. But there was just a little too much sauce, including on top, which drowned the crab. For dessert, everyone split the mango sticky rice ($7) which lasted about 3 minutes on the table. The tart and sweet mangoes with the sweet rice was a great finish.  We were definitely impressed with just about everything about our experience and there's no doubt we'll be back.

t8OyVi6aWwZsZEtMxLdCmw.text: Really nice restaurant. The food presentation was beautiful and the food was also GREAT!

4QTe-gL8sgAC-gWPIdgxZg.text: Just okay thai food and we both got sick following our meal.  We came here on a whim one evening after passing by this spot so many times. I was impressed by the vibe of the spot - small, but cozy. The service was good, and our food was prepared rather quickly which was nice. I had pad see ew, and my boyfriend had the pad thai. My dish was decent? It was very heavy in sauce which was surprising. I will point out that the portions we received were generous as well. Following our meal however, we both had upset stomachs for the rest of the evening, despite not even finishing our food.  I would come back had our food been a little better, and we both not gotten sick. Overall cute place with acceptable food - hopefully other folks have better experiences!

1NJ5yN70Lw7jYFeiLq7a1g.text: Ordered a few items for pick up. Once I had picked up my entrees and drove all the way home I noticed the bag leaking. When I checked my entrees the entire bag was filled with my pho soup that I had ordered. Whoever packaged the meal put my soup into a cracked to-go-bowl. My soup was now completely drained into the bag and it ruined the rest of my entrees as well as the seat in my car. I will never be ordering from here again.

iL7Ur4RRdw5eDl-CkWriVg.text: Went here last night because we were in the area and felt like having some Thai food, the atmosphere was nice and the restaurant was clean and comfortable. Service was also good and quick. We ordered tom kha soup (with tofu), beef pho, and spicy eggplant with shrimp. Everything had a great flavor. The soup could have been more sour (but that's just my preference, I love sour foods) but I like how the broth for the small size was kept in a pitcher on the side so it stayed warm and I could continue pouring more onto the veggies and aromatics when I wanted it. The spicy eggplant had a delicious sauce with decent spice (I asked for 3/5 to be safe even though my tolerance for spice is pretty high, and it was good), and the shrimp were cooked perfectly. The only part I disliked was actually the eggplant- for some reason they were breaded and fried which I felt was unnecessary and took away from the dish because the breading felt too dense/thick and as leftovers became soggy and not good- I removed as much of it as I could. Other than that, we enjoyed Table Thai!

EHibt_iA7Ws2LGj7VdbvHQ.text: It is rare for a restaurant to be good enough (or bad enough) to inspire me to write a review for it.  However, my experience with Table Thai demands that I do so here.  If there has even been a restaurant in my over 50 years of dining experiences that deserves a perfect score, this has got to be the one!  My wife (who is native Chinese) and I dined here a few hours before a flight out of Vegas.  We entered the restaurant hoping for a decent Thai restaurant experience (where our previous Asian food experiences in Vegas have been awfully disappointing!).  Having experienced an exceptional meal here, we left the restaurant seriously depressed that we lived out-of-state and would be unable to return to this restaurant again often!  First and foremost, the waitress/hostess was ENTHUSIASTIC about her work.  She was extremely friendly, helpful, and genuinely cared about our dining experience.  She spent a lot of time telling us about their best dishes (more than a dozen) and guided us in making good choices for our meal.  Second, the atmosphere was very pleasant, tasteful, and elegantly casual.  It was a serious step up from the austere outside view of the strip mall containing the restaurant.  Everything was clean and organized with care and good judgement.  Finally, the food was top notch!  We ordered Tom Kha Gai soup, Phad Thai with chicken and shrimp, and Red Curry with ground pork.  All three were excellent!  Thai food is our favorite cuisine.  So we are quite experienced with these food choices (both in the USA as well as in Asia).  The Phad Thai was slightly sweet as it should be (but not overly sweet as found in many other restaurants) with the right amount of fish sauce (not too salty) and the right amount of spice heat to make it memorable.  (The only odd thing about the Phad Thai was that it was served with a lemon slice and not a lime slice.)  The soup was perfectly blended (not too "limey" or too "coconutty") and served above a flame heat.  The red curry was the most memorable of all!  I *LOVE* curry!  This curry was the most deeply flavored and rich in flavor (but not too thick or too thin in consistency).  Like most restaurants, Table Thai gives you the choice of meats including chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, tofu, and more.  What is not like most restaurants is that they also offer ground chicken, ground beef, and ground pork.  We ordered the curry with the ground pork and found it to be a revealing experience!  The ground pork provided much more flavor to the curry (but not fatty or oily)!  It reminded me of the first time that I tasted Thai food so many years ago.  I remember the excitement of new and wonderful tastes that I had never previously experienced.  This red curry with ground pork gave me that same new experience!!  Wonderful!  My wife and I cannot wait until returning to Vegas in the future solely for being able to eat at this restaurant!!  (Oh, my wife and I could not believe the relatively low prices - especially considering the high quality!)

siJMhJWTv0d4MFrdy9qdsw.text: I definitely recommend it . Nice enviroment, the chairs are so comfy, and everything is so cute. The food was fabulous also the service. Special thanks for Napat that took really good care of us.

QTyfthkk66amFgmSu2peXg.text: Wow!!! I am so glad we found this place. The food,staff and ambiance were all top notch. When we come back to Vegas we will definitely come back. Our $60 uber bill for 4 miles was so worth it after we found this gem.

AogxIzvPHyu5Mye-F9DHGg.text: EASY 5 stars.   *Atmosphere- The restaurant itself has a great relaxing atmosphere. The chair you sit on, your table, and the decorations are all top of the line. They don't cut any corners.  *Service- Flawless. The waitresses are all dressed in classy matching outfits, super friendly and very attentive. We were there when it was busy too.  *Food- My massaman curry was amazing. Good portion size, great presentation and perfectly cooked. My Thai girlfriend loves pad see eiw and is kind of a snob when it comes to her thai food.  She says it is the best she's ever had. Also, the thai ice coffee was delicious.  It was a great choice for Valentine's and we'll definitely be back.

2t6oHSASJLV8U-U_DH9pZA.text: Best wonton soup I have ever had. The broth was very flavorful and a little bit salty and the wontons themselves we're much better than the typical wonton. I also am a fan of the orange chicken because it actually tastes like oranges and not just a Sweet sauce. 5/5 I will return often.

dGq3soLNjA3aQigeBWRfMw.text: I love this place, great Thai food and if you ask for no MSG, they'll do it. The portions are huge. Highly recommend

SJSO3ea4zr4SRFXjtdjT2w.text: Have been here twice and am certainly working it into my list of regular stops during my frequent trips to Vegas. All of the dishes I have tried are excellent. The crying tiger is tender and grilled perfectly. The fried rice has just the right amount of crunch from vegetables and the rice is somewhere between fluffy and sticky. Perfect. The Tom yum soup is also made of some of the best broth I have ever had. Be careful with the "number" of heat you ask for. 3 was almost too much. I also want to point out that they serve some of the best brewed iced tea I have ever tasted and it is served in Mason Jars that are kept full. The two noodle dishes I have tried were also great and portions huge. This is by far one of the best Thai restaurants in town. Try it.

0DMRtrcFeVv2NMn-9jrOPQ.text: Delivery service was reasonably priced and arrived about 10 minutes earlier than estimated delivery time.  The man who delivered my food was very friendly. The chicken Tom Kha soup was delicious! 5 stars for the soup and service, however...  I will definitely be ordering it again in the future.  I was less impressed with the pumpkin shrimp curry as it was pretty bland. I ordered the medium level of spiciness and it was definitely very mild.  There was a good amount of vegetables and shrimp in the curry, but the lack of spice made it pretty boring for me.  2.5 stars for this dish

SN1go3DzVVOiCpsMQE87iA.text: Ordered Panang curry and the chicken was raw.  The taste of the curry was amazing until I got to my first bite of pink rubbery chicken then I had to hold back my vomit....  If the chicken had been thoroughly cooked it probably would've been perfect. I would just rather not risk that experience again or bother risking salmonella/food poisoning.   I won't be back to say the least. If they make sure their meats are thoroughly cooked I'm sure it tastes great. Just a risk you gotta take I suppose. I just personally can't stomach raw chicken.  Good luck.
